date: Fri, 19 Feb 2021 17:25:31 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: <Dave.Chesson@gmail.com>
subject: WonderCon Panel: How to Create Your Own Novel: From First Idea to Publishing and What You Need to Sell Your Work Into TV and Film

Body:
Hi Dave,

Here's what we did at San Diego Comic-Con (the virtual Comic-Con) last year:

**

*How to Create Your Own Novel: From the first idea to publishing and 
what you need to sell your work to TV and Film*

*

The Winner Twins, Brittany and Brianna, multiple award-winning and 
national-bestselling science fiction and fantasy authors, will explain 
how to create your own novel step by step, from building your universe 
to overcoming writer's block to the different paths to publishing. They 
will be joined by Todd McCaffrey (New York Times bestselling author, 
Dragonriders of Pern), Kevin J Anderson (New York Times bestselling 
author and publisher of Wordfire Press, The Saga of Seven Suns, The Star 
Wars Universe, The Dune Universe), and Rebecca Moesta 
(national-bestselling author, publisher and CEO of Wordfire Press, Buffy 
the Vampire Slayer, Junior Jedi Knights, A Christmas to Remember). They 
will share their war stories, their writing secrets, and discuss their 
insights and advice on writing through the Covid-19 era.

*

*You can watch the reult on Youtube:
*

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kiwNrnvStJ0 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kiwNrnvStJ0>*

*

Our thought we be to bring you into the conversation when we talk about 
indie publishing.

Cheers,

Todd

*

date: Sun, 13 Dec 2020 15:43:21 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: <dean.wmgworkshops@gmail.com>
subject: Crime Assign #2

Body:
**

*Actually, holiday crime stories aren’t something I think much about.  I 
had to do a search online just to get ideas.*

*

The was one d’ohthat came back:

How the Grinch Stole Christmasby Dr. Seuss (aka, Theodor Seuss 
Geissel).  The basic story is a heist reneged: the Grinch decides to 
steal all of Christmas from the town of Who-ville, figuring that the 
Whos will all be sad.  When the deed is complete and yet stillthey 
celebrate, he learns the true meaning of Christmas, repents, and returns 
the gifts.  This is a feel-good story.

As I thought about it more, I realized that Harry Potter and the 
Philosopher’s (Sorcerer’s, US) Stoneby J.K. Rowling is alsoa Christmas 
crime story.  In fact, multiple crimes are attempted, several 
committed.  At Christmas, Harry receives mysteriously an invisibility 
cloak which enables him to perform many capers and ultimately to track 
down the criminal who wants to steal the philosopher’s stone.  At which 
point, Lord Voldemort, co-inhabiting the body of Professor Quirrell, 
attempts murder.  Harry survives.  This is another example of a 
feel-good story.

The next book, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secretsis also holiday 
related (Halloween), as is the fourth (Harry Potter and the Goblet of 
Fire) which reprises the Yule holiday.  And, of course, all the books 
involve unsuccessful attempts to murder Harry Potter.

And, just now, I realized that an old favorite, Donna Andrews’ Murder 
with Peacocks,centers upon three weddings and a murder.  This is another 
example of murder and attempted murder. Also an example of a feel-good 
story.*

Todd McCaffrey

date: Sat, 21 Aug 2021 19:55:57 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Georgeanne Kennedy<squeej51g@gmail.com>
subject: How's it going?

Body:
HI Squeej,

I've been saying to myself for a couple of weeks now, "I should write 
Gigi and ask her how things are going with her."

So... How's it going?

Over here, we're hanging in. We're worried about the delta variant, 
particularly because Brit's doctor has told her specifically NOT to get 
the vaccine -- it might make things much worse for her.

As it is, Brit will be heading back to LA to see an eye doctor at UCLA 
because in the past several weeks she's noticed two very troubling 
things: her hearing has gotten worse and her eyesight has gotten worse.  
A good retinal doctor here in Vegas detected signs of thinning in the 
optic nerve.  Not good.  Brit took the news in stride.  She's hoping 
that it's Usher's Type 3 because then she'll have a diagnosis.  It also 
helps that the eye doctor in UCLA has seen her before, willingly calls 
*her* and is also the guy who originally determined the existence of 
Usher's Type 3. Anyway, we cross fingers.  In the meantime, Brit has got 
hearing aids and loves being able to hear things she didn't notice for 
the past five years -- like being able to hear her nails tapping on things.

I am busy writing a sequel to a novel I just completed.  The first 
novel, RAW SPACE, is out with alpha readers.  You know, nothing out of 
the ordinary, just a space opera where someone has planted zombie sex 
bugs on the Fleet's laundry ship ;)

I hope you're doing well.

Love,

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Re: A/C woes
Date: 	Thu, 17 Jun 2021 12:00:14 -0700
From: 	Kenneth Lee <klee10026@gmail.com>
To: 	todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,

I am sorry you still have issues with the AC unit. I thought the last 
time Hot Cold Air came out, they had fixed all the problems.

I have forwarded your message to them and asked for a solution. 
Hopefully they can send a knowledgeable technician to take care of it 
once for all. I will keep you posted.

----------------
Best Regards,
Kenneth
(702) 580-0968
klee10026@gmail.com <mailto:klee10026@gmail.com>

On Wed, Jun 16, 2021 at 8:42 PM todd <todd@toddwriter.com 
<mailto:todd@toddwriter.com>> wrote:

    Dear Mr Lee,

    I would like to request someone to fix the A/C. Here is the situation.
    The A/C system is one condenser with two internal thermostats, one
    upstairs and one down stairs. There is a damper, which is movable flap
    inside the duct work that directs air flow downstair or upstairs
    depending on the settings of the thermostat.

    At some point in time in the past one of the thermostats was
    disconnected and so the damper does not adjust airflow, since there is
    only one thermostat attached.

    I would like to get the second thermostat reconnected and confirm the
    damper is working correctly to cool both floors as soon as possible.

    As it is right now, the AC is running continuously. Even when the
    system
    is turned OFF, the fans still run. When the system is set to COOL, the
    thermostat setting downstairs has no effect -- and the system runs
    continuously, without regards to temperature (the temperature has been
    68 when the thermostat was set to 72), nothing short of turning the AC
    to OFF on the thermostat effects that (and, as I said, even then the
    fans continue to run). None of this can be good for the AC system.

    At this very moment, my room temperature is 79.3 degrees which is
    intolerable.

    I look forward to hearing from you immediately.

    Sincerely,
    Todd McCaffrey

date: Sun, 30 Aug 2020 00:27:36 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Amelia Johnson<amelia.mj@live.com>
subject: Memories of your Dad and stuff

Body:
*

Hi Amelia,

Here's a quick partial brain dump to give you some more info about who 
your Dad is. Feel free to share with Eliza. I'll write more as I get the 
time. (I'm still REALLY sad about Chadwick Boseman - his is a great loss.)

We grew up in several locations in the US, all in the northeast:

 1.

    Montclair, NJ.  I left when I was two and have no memories.

 2.

    100 Danforth Place, Windybush, Wilmington, Delaware

     1.

        With one interruption, we lived there from the time I was 2
        (1958) until we moved to 369 Carpenter Ave., Sea Cliff, Long
        Island, NY in 1965

 3.

    369 Carpenter Avenue, Sea Cliff, Long Island, New York

     1.

        We lived there from 1965 until we (Gigi, Mum, and I) moved to
        Ireland in 1970

 4.

    In Ireland (just to continue the record), we first lived in:

     1.

          14 North Avenue, Mount Merrion (1970-71)

     2.

        Meadowbrook House, Dundrum (1971-72)

         1.

            Alec joined us there and became a trawler fisherman.

     3.

        Site 11 Rochestown Avenue (1972-73)

         1.

            Alec wasn’t here

     4.

        79 Shanganagh Vale, Cabinteely (1973-1979?)

         1.

            Nor was Alec here.

     5.

        Dragonhold, Kilquade, Co. Wicklow (1979-1987)

         1.

            He visited here occasionally

     6.

         From there, Mum moved into Dragonhold-Underhill and lived there
        until she died in 2011.

I have many memories of Alec, some of which are great and some of which 
are not.

When we were in 100 Danforth, we all got kittens: Tasso (Alec), Tallabar 
(me), and Silkie Blackington (for Gigi with much adult supervision in 
the naming else the cat would have been simply “Blackie”).

Tasso was a tortoise shell.  He lost an argument with a car not long 
after we got him. Alec was devastated.

Tallabar was a multi-color, a mix of grays and oranges.  Quite the 
pretty cat.

Silkie was your average black cat.  She was sweet and her fur was very 
soft, hence the name.

Silkie and Tallabar went on to have many, many litters.  Tallabar was 
good at producing orange marmalade cats.

We also had dogs, starting with Wizard (a German Shepherd) followed by 
his son, Merlin.  Wiz decided that I was his human charge. We had a 
sloping hill outside our front door and it went down to join the street 
which formed part of the branches of a tee-junction (the other street 
tee’d into Danforth Place).  Wiz decided that I was not allowed to go 
down that hill when I was an infant and took to blocking me.

Our next door neighbors (to our left as you’re standing in the front 
door looking out) were the Estes.  Larry Estes was Alec’s age.  I think 
their daughter was close to Gigi’s age.  Alec and Larry hung out and I 
did my best to tag along, often successfully.

There was another housing estate being built across the railroad tracks 
beyond a small woods at the edge of Windybush and we used to trek there 
many a  time. The woods had some pretty decent undergrowth. One day 
Larry got a hold of his father’s machete (from WWII) and he and Alec 
took turns “clearing” the underbrush (think Indiana Jones in South 
America at the beginning of Raiders of the Lost Ark).  I must have been 
around six.  At one point Alec told me to stand back.  I did but, 
apparently, not far enough and the machete tore into my shin.  I think 
it was Alec who carried me back to the house. I went to the ER and got 
four stitches.

Another  time, when I was eight or so, we had a particularly hard but 
dry winter.  It was decided to go exploring (“mountain climbing”?) in 
the culverts at the upper side of the estate.  Alec had brought a hammer 
along to poke holes in the ice as handholds.  He told me (seems to be a 
pattern here) to get back and swung immediately after I said, “Okay” but 
before I could comply (well, that’s my story) and I got the claws of the 
hammer hitting my head -- just on the eye socket.  A bit lower and I 
would have lost the eye.  As it was, I got two stitches without novocaine.

Ah, the good years!

Alec and I fought often enough that I have many recollections of 
variously being forced to eat grass or dirt to escape being buried under 
him.

In 1962 we moved to Dusseldorf, Germany for six months because Dad had a 
job doing PR work for DuPont that required him to work there.  Overall, 
it was a marvelous experience.  Alec, Gigi, and I were all very 
nordic-looking and, when we didn’t speak, had no trouble passing for 
German (Dad’s family had roots in Schleswig-Holstein on the 
German-Danish border).  Mum place Alec and I in the local German 
school.  I can’t say how well Alec did but I flourished, having a 
teacher who could speak English (she was raised in England during the 
war) and I learned excellent “gekauft Deutsch” -- as Mum called it 
(“shopping German”).

We all adored the chocolate over there.  We took the tram everywhere, 
un-parented.  I recall once having some old Frau look at us and scoff, 
“Ach, Englander!” to which I replied, “Nein, Amerikaner!” -- that seemed 
to both affront and appease her, somewhat (the English had ruled the 
area after the war and weren’t particularly good at it).

They had these marvelous parades where they’d throw candy.  We all loved 
that.

We got a VW station wagon while we were over there and, when our time 
was up, drove around Europe (France, Germany, Holland, at least).  We 
took the ferry to England.  We were broke, so we camped one night all in 
the VW and discovered later the next day that we’d stopped outside an 
insane asylum.  We dropped the car off for transport to the States and 
headed to Gatwick airport (Heathrow was not then built), only to 
discover that there was some tax that we still had to pay before we 
could board the flight back.  This caused the parents immense distress 
until a nice American couple, hearing the panic, loaned us the money 
(there were Texans).

*

date: Sat, 11 Dec 2021 02:14:35 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Georgeanne Kennedy<squeej51g@gmail.com>
subject: Re: Catching up

Body:
"A Boy Called Christmas" is on Netflix. I just recently watched it again.

Good on you with the job.  It's nice to get out.

I do most of my writing at Starbucks. It's nice to look up and see 
people while I'm working.

Glad to hear that Owen is happy.

I've been submitting artwork to Illustrators of the Future (even though 
I'm a Writer judge, I'm allowed) and have received "Honorable Mentions" 
twice now. I'd rather like winning outright but I'll work on it.

I'm glad that you added your voice on the Hungarian translator. I quite 
agree that Mum would get a kick out of the whole thing and would be 
actively PUSHING to get it done.

I have a fan wondering if there'll be any more Tower & Hive books and 
another wondering if there'll be more Doona books.

At 20BooksTo50k I chatted with Kevin Ikenberry, another writer and, it 
turns out a retired LTC from the Army.  He's teaching the guys at 
Spaceforce. We were talking about writing a series set out on the 
Asteroid Belt as I believe that's the next great frontier and we should 
get into it (as a species) so writing about it might help the movement, 
as it were.

Any collaborations like that will wait until I get the six (hopefully no 
more) books in the Canaris Rift series done.  I just recently did a new 
cover which I decided I'd use for the fourth book, /Pirate Queen/, which 
is right now at 18,000+ words.

The Twins got a really cool write-up in the local newspaper, The Las 
Vegas Review-Journal 
<https://www.reviewjournal.com/rj-magazine/amazing-stories-of-the-unbelievable-sci-fi-sisters-2474997/>.  
You can read it by following the link.

We're thinking that our next major convention will be WonderCon in April 
2022 (Anaheim Convention Center, just across the street from Disney).  
Maybe you should consider coming, see what working a booth is like, get 
out and see the weirdness that is a comic-con (and then do Disney to 
recover <g>).  I'm sure that tons of fans would love to meet you, and 
you'd be surprised at how rewarding it is to interact with them.

After WonderCon, it's Writers of the Future the very next weekend! (whoosh!)

Love you!

-- Todd

from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Donald Maass<dmaass@maassagency.com>
subject: Open Road Media

Body:
Hi Don,

I hope you're well and surviving COVID.

I've been looking over contracts and see that my two contracts with Open 
Road Media for /Dragonholder/ and /The One Tree of Luna/ are due to 
expire December 22, 2021.

I would be quite happy to extend the /Dragonholder/ contract for another 
three years.  In fact, I have an updated version I can send them in 
InDesign format.

I would like to regain the rights to /The One Tree of Luna/, however.

Naturally, with regards to the rights continued with Open Road Media, I 
would hope that you would continue to act as my agent.

Cheers,

Todd McCaffrey

Message: Hello, I just have to give a little background first, I 
actually met the two of you during a book signing at my elementary 
school for your book Strand Prophecy and I remember it being one of my 
favorite books and re reading it multiple times. Recently I was asked to 
think back to a time when I was inspired by a book and upon thinking 
about all the books I have read. I remembered yours. It took me a couple 
days of searching to find and remember your book and I was so happy when 
I finally found it and bought it because over the years I do not know 
where my original copy went sadly and it was even signed by the two of 
you. I am not asking for another signed book I just felt that I should 
reach out and share a good, happy memory I have because of the two of 
you. I hope all is well during these uncertain times. I look forward to 
rereading your book and getting to relive the moment as a child when I 
read it for the first time. Thank you for time and reading this 
lengthily message. Take care and stay safe during this pandemic. Moon, 
Derek R.
Phone 2: 7144024614

date: Tue, 20 Jul 2021 19:57:57 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: David Weber<davidweber@davidweber.net>
subject: Thank you!

Body:
Hi David,

Thank you for getting me a copy of "A Call to Insurrection!"

it was much enjoyed!

One niggle -- at the end of the last book, Calvingdell and Locatelli are 
involved in a coin toss over who gets Travis. I  do wish that had been 
explicitly resolved.

It's nice to see Travis and Gavin communicating.

The situation with Serisburg seemed to beg for a bit more preamble and I 
thought Chomps might have been a lot quicker on the up-take. I think I 
also would have liked to see more personalities involved in the 
ONI/Delphi clash.

Even though I've seen them both before, I got a bit muddled with 
Damocles and Diacritos -- both being D names. I would have loved a bit 
more of "the courier ship, Diacritos" to keep them clear.

I do certainly look forward to more!

Cheers,

Todd

Subject: Fwd: For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman

Body:
Also for YOUR information.

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by 
Steven-Elliot Altman
Date: 	Thu, 11 Feb 2021 04:31:01 +0500
From: 	Steve Altman <steve@socialimpulse.com>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

Hey Todd,

Steve Altman here. Hope this email finds you well, it's been awhile, and 
I pray we all get to meet up at conventions again. <sigh>

In the meantime, please forgive my shameless promotion here. I'm gunning 
for recommendations for my last History channel videogame, /Project Blue 
Book/ with little or no guidance and have drummed up this post on the 
SFWA board. For amplification purposes I am sending it out to certain 
SFWA members who may be interested in playing and/or reading the game's 
script for consideration. Hope you won't mind being on my list. Did you 
happen to catch the TV series? Well worth watching.

Here is an overview of *Project Blue Book: The Game* with the attached 
game script for your consideration (as well as some smaller samples) and 
links to play the game for free. Enjoy!

The information below has been posted in its entirety on the Members 
Only SFWA message boards at the following link, and should be treated 
confidentially: 
https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/>

Project Blue Book The Game Image 2.png

Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman and Julie Marsh

Please find attached the Final Production Draft of Project Blue Book: 
The Game, which I wrote for A&E Networks based on their History Channel 
series, along with my clue writer Julie Marsh (Julie was not credited on 
the game itself, as I was featured, but I am compelled to include her 
for consideration due to her essential contributions).

I was attempting to bring the genres of television writing and videogame 
writing one step closer. I was given nearly free reign by the network 
and showrunners on how to proceed, and so decided to write my own 
adaptations of half the game's cases based on produced episodes of the 
TV series (with additional scenes that I envisioned) and the other half 
of the cases as original cases which I based on actual declassified 
U.S.A.F Project Blue Book files.

The Production Draft encompasses all 9 Cases of Season One of the game. 
Because this document is quite lengthy I have also attached "Case 105: 
The Aztec Recovery" (in which I introduce J. Robert Oppenheimer to the 
game's story) and "Case 107: Project Rainbow" (in which I 
introduce Albert Einstein to the game's story, in a story previously 
dramatized as the feature film /The Philadelphia Experiment/) as two 
smaller samples of the complete work.

Besides the script, the game is FREE TO PLAY as a mobile app available 
for both IOS and Android phones and tablets in the safe links listed 
below, and I invite you to play!

Project Blue Book: The Game on IOS 
<https://apps.apple.com/us/app/project-blue-book-the-game/id1445162277>

Project Blue Book: The Game on Android 
<https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.threegates.projectbluebook&hl=en_US>

And for anyone who does not wish to actually play the game, here are 
two youtube videos posted by players that depict the game's opening 
tutorial, and the start of CASE 101, The Fuller Dogfight.

Project Blue Book Opening Cut Scene and Tutorial 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFhBUpUeqsE&t=5s>

Project Blue Book Case 101 Walkthrough 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OOhAgdjG7bY&t=23s>

And finally, here is the approved description from the app store:

Project Blue Book: The Game is the official, free-to-play, hidden object 
adventure game based on HISTORY’s hit drama series PROJECT BLUE BOOK, 
created by David O'Leary, and executive produced by Academy Award and 
Golden Globe® winner Robert Zemeckis. The series explores the 
historical, Top Secret investigations into UFOs conducted by the U.S. 
Air Force between 1952 and 1969.

In Project Blue Book: The Game, you will start off as a newly recruited 
agent in Project Blue Book during the 1950s, under the guidance of the 
show's lead investigators, Dr. J. Allen Hynek (played by Aidan Gillen 
from “Game Of Thrones”), and Captain Michael Quinn (played by Michael 
Malarkey from “The Vampire Diaries”), and begin to investigate real 
declassified UFO investigations to find the truth!

Hundreds of puzzles, witness interviews and hidden object scenes will 
challenge your observation and deduction tactics as you investigate 
alongside your favorite characters into many of the cases you loved from 
the series, uncover exclusive new content, and explore new cases that 
can only be found in the game! The game's story is written by 
bestselling science-fiction writer and award-winning game writer 
Steven-Elliot Altman, best known for similar social games like PEARL’S 
PERIL and ANCIENT ALIENS.

We're here to find the truth! So, come help us investigate flying 
saucers along with Dr. Hynek in the world's first Unidentified Flying 
(Hidden) Object Game!

Thank you for considering *Project Blue Book: The Game* for a Nebula 
Nomination in the best game writing category. Should you wish to 
nominate it, here is the SFWA link: https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/>

Love and light to you and your family,
Steve

*Steven-Elliot Altman*
Chief Executive Officer

  Phone  +1 (323) 708-9005
  Fax       +1 (877) 581-8750
  Site Socialimpulse.com <http://Socialimpulse.com>

Subject: Re: Hey

Body:
Wow!  I went looking for your email address and discovered that we 
haven't talked in nearly two years!
I'm sorry, that was not my intent (I occasionally get the "oh, s/he is 
too busy for me!" -- although recently I've decided that it's just a 
stupid way of thinking).

I hope you're doing well and life is treating you with an the 
magnificence it should!

We're still surviving the marvels of COVID and the stupidities of 
Republicans (yuk).

I am writing.  And now I'm driving a nice red, modest, Tesla.  It's well 
past time to switch to electric cars.

I've been putting some stuff up on Etsy, mostly re-purposing covers 
because, why not?

I had a wild thought the other night: It'd be great to have Alan come 
out here to Vegas for a visit, four days or so.
Is it possible to get his contact info at all?

Cheers,
Todd

date: Mon, 11 Oct 2021 17:10:15 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Joni Labaqui<Jonil@authorservicesinc.com>
subject: Travel

Body:
Hi Joni,

I hope you're well!

I haven't heard anything regarding travel and all for the Awards ceremony.

I'm guessing from the Awards date of the 22nd that the Writers and 
Illustrators should be coming in on the 15th, right?

When do you want us on hand?

For myself, I'll need to get a tux and I'll want at least a day either 
side of the event, preferably more beforehand but at least a day of 
recovery after (so that I can stay up late and not worry about rushing 
out the next day).

Cheers,

Todd

Subject: I'm buying a Tesla!

Body:
HI Squeej,

I decided that I needed to go electric, so I'm buying a Tesla.

I've already ordered the car but I had an issue with their website so I 
went to the store and got that sorted.  While there, I also arranged a 
test drive. Whoo-ee! WHAT a beautiful piece of technology!  Much better 
pickup than the Prius and better stopping, too.

I'm thrilled!

In other news, our book, /The Magpie's War/, will be released on Monday. 
We're really thrilled with it.

Love,

Todd

Body:
this is probably more for you!

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Team Doodly wants to better serve you in 2020. Here's how.
Date: 	Thu, 02 Jan 2020 11:42:46 -0600
From: 	Brad Callen <doodly@bryxen.com>
To: 	Todd McCaffrey <todd@toddwriter.com>

Preview

Hey Todd, 2019 has been a great year for the Doodly community. We've 
interacted with so many incredible Doodlers (mainly via the private 
Facebook group 
<https://bryxen.acemlna.com/lt.php?s=e6528b5af8d60160647c91e234f808d0&i=206A249A7A744>) 
and we've seen so many absolutely amazing Doodle videos that have been 
created in the past year, alone.

Going into 2020, we want to continue supporting you as best we can. In 
order to do that, we have 2 super short questions to ask you.

Would you mind taking 10 seconds of your time and letting us know the 
answers to these 2 questions?

Go here to see the 2 questions:

https://forms.gle/jAQx81NC8EK5z3zeA 
<https://bryxen.acemlna.com/lt.php?s=e6528b5af8d60160647c91e234f808d0&i=206A249A7A745>

Thank you so much for helping make Doodly what it is today, and here's 
to a fantastic 2020!

Brad Callen

Sent to: todd@toddwriter.com

Unsubscribe 
<http://bryxen.acemlna.com/proc.php?nl=7&c=206&m=249&s=e6528b5af8d60160647c91e234f808d0&act=unsub>

Dear Professionals,

We apologize for the confusion! Due to an internal error, when we 
re-sent barcode confirmations for WonderCon 2022 Professional badges,

Subject: Fwd: How's it going?

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Re: How's it going?
Date: 	Sun, 22 Aug 2021 06:03:07 +0100
From: 	Georgeanne Kennedy <squeej51g@gmail.com>
To: 	todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Ah, sweetie! It’s lovely of you to check in, and probably couldn’t come 
at a better time.
You asked, so I ain’t gonna hold back. Tune in your big brother 
listening ears cause your baby sister needs sound advice. I have to 
admit, I’m not doing too well. Wish I could fluff away, all light and 
breezy, and tell you ‘I’m grand’ but I’m not. I guess it’s a combination 
of things but, predominantly, living on my own, away from the area I’ve 
known for over 40 years, is incredibly hard and seems to magnify any 
other difficult issues I experience in my life as a single 60-something. 
It’s like I’m starting all over again, when I’m already starting over 
again since my marriage ended. The property market here is a mess, with 
houses selling far above asking price because there’s a scarcity of 
stock for sale, so I can’t afford to buy anything now and lay down new 
roots. The holding pattern I’m in is excruciating!

And I guess other aspects of my life, and the seemingly never-ending 
crises that are engulfing the earth, are all mixing together to fill my 
plate with a gloomy looking repast. I should stop reading the news.

Sleep is difficult; I’ve been wide awake for an hour and it’s not yet 
5am, so this day’s store of resilience is already fecked up. - I have to 
go to Owen’s girlfriend’s place today to help celebrate the “gender 
reveal” (slap me quick before I gag!) they have planned now that their 
gestating baby is 3 months along. It’ll be the first time I’ll be in the 
same air space as Geoff since we were in court getting our divorce 
decree; when I bawled my eyes out in front of everyone whilst giving 
testimony. Oy! Added to that, Owen has, frankly, been treating me like a 
piece of shit over the last few months so the strain is telling. I’ll be 
a big girl, though, go along to see what sex the baby will be and try to 
smile a lot.

About two weeks ago Geoff’s youngest sister, Edel, the main carer for my 
(ex?) mother-in-law, Joan, was in a terrible car crash while travelling 
to Cork for a weekend break with her boyfriend. She’s broken the bones 
in the top of her foot, and two vertebrae just above the tailbone. She 
literally broke her arse. Poor Mick, her boyfriend, is far worse off and 
will remain in hospital in Cork for at least another 6 weeks, undergoing 
another couple of surgeries on top of the 3 he’s already had. Fuck! What 
a nightmare, and no visitors allowed to see him. Poor guy.

And then a totally strange series of things have occurred recently with 
regard to my late sister-in-law’s husband, Noel. He’s a very successful 
businessman and a pub owner and has been trying to cope with the sudden 
death of his wife in June 2019, along with the grief their two (young) 
adult kids are experiencing, plus the lack of pub business due to Covid.

I’ve kept in loose touch with Noel ever since he asked me to write and 
deliver Maria’s eulogy. Over the last couple of years, through texts, 
he’s always suggested that we get together for a drink and catch up 
which I’ve always put down as pure politeness. Recently he suggested the 
same thing but in a phone call when he told me about Edel’s crash, which 
no one else in the Kennedy clan had informed me of.

Edel has always been close to Noel and she asked him to drive to Cork to 
be with her whilst she gave an official report to the Gardai regarding 
the crash. So here’s where it gets weird, Tig. Noel asked me to drive 
with him to Cork to collect Edel but suggested we go down the day before 
her release, have a nice meal, a few drinks and “a laugh”, and stay the 
night in an hotel before we retrieve Edel the following day. Whilst he 
was suggesting this plan I was uncommonly quiet on the other end of the 
phone and Noel said we would, of course, have separate rooms because he 
“wasn’t going to try and climb into bed with me”. The thought never 
crossed my mind! To be honest, I wasn’t sure what the fuck was going on 
but it’s been a very long time since I’ve been in the company of a kind 
man who wanted to hang out with me, so I agreed, thinking what harm 
could come of it.

At any rate, as it turned out, Edel didn’t have to have an interview 
with the Gardai in Cork and without discussing it with me, Noel changed 
his initial plan ‘to have a laugh’, and we simply drove to and from Cork 
on the same day to collect Edel. I reckon he possibly had a good think 
about what he’d proposed and decided against it. We had a pleasant time 
talking on the way down to Cork but I couldn’t forget the fact that I’m 
fairly certain he’d possibly made a pass at me. Or did he? I have no clue.

So my silly girl head can’t stop thinking about this, and Noel. In fact, 
it’s wrecking my head, and living alone doesn’t help; I already spend 
*way* too much time in my own head. I keep scolding myself to stop! but 
I’m lonely, and would like a man to like me again. I guess I’m just 
going to have to let time do it’s magical thing and allow it all to 
slowly fade away. Talk to me, Todd. Give me your take on this. Sorry 
this is so long but, hell! I’m long-winded.

Love,
Skin

Sent from my iPad

subject: PhD?

Body:
Hi Gigi,

You mentioned a PhD program and I seem to recall Johnny Carson being 
involved but when I looked at University of Nebraska-Lincoln, I couldn't 
see anything that seemed to match.

Could you refresh my memory?

Also, thanks for hanging out with me at WotF. I  only later thought that 
perhaps you'd had zillions of other similar events over the year in 
other fields (e.g.: music), so if it turned out deadly dull, I'm sorry.

-- Todd

From: *Summer Trail* <summertrail@terrawest.com>
Date: Fri, Nov 9, 2018 at 1:27 PM
Subject: RE: Summer Trail HOA - Parking permit
To: Kenneth Lee <klee10026@gmail.com>

Good afternoon,

Thank you for taking the time to write. I will mail a new parking permit 
to the resident. Please note, the previous permit has been voided. Any 
vehicle parked on the street with permit #057 will be towed immediately 
at the owner’s sole expense.

Have a pleasant weekend.

*Tanya Matysek*
/Community Administrative Assistant
Summer Trail Homeowners Association
/Terra West Management Services
6655 S. Cimarron Road, Suite 200 | Las Vegas, NV 89113
(702) 856-3876 *office* | (702) 998-6020 *fax*

<mailto:summertrail@terrawest.com>

*To:* Summer Trail <summertrail@terrawest.com>
*Subject:* Re: Summer Trail HOA - Parking permit

Our new tenant moved in in July. May be due to the moving transition, 
the mail got lost. As far as I know, we didn't receive any parking 
permit #057. Is there any way we can have a replacement?

I do encourage our tenant to park his car inside the garage so that his 
guest can parked on the driveway. But some times they do have more than 
a couple of friends to come and visit, therefore we do need one parking 
permit. Please advise how to obtain a replacement or a new one?

Thank you very much for your time.

Body:
Hi Dean,

I sent you a copy of "A Dragonrider from Pern" to your other email 
address and then re-read the story (I last looked at it over five years 
ago).

I found typos (OMG) and a few other bits I wanted to correct, so 
attached is the corrected version.

You should read it instead of the first one.

Cheers,

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WELCOME TO 101 SELF PUBLISHING
Date: 	Fri, 26 Mar 2021 17:09:28 -0400 (EDT)
From: 	Mark Dawson <mark@selfpublishingformula.com>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

Your Welcome Message from Mark Dawson
image

*Hello!*

A huge welcome to Self Publishing 101.

Self publishing can be complicated and confusing and I want this course 
to be your easy-to-follow and comprehensive guide to what you need to 
have in place in order to thrive as an independent author.

This email contains important information - please save it for future 
reference.

The course materials can be accessed at this address:

https://selfpublishingformula.com/mycourses 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/4698703130132480/4946397635936256>

Please bookmark this link.

Once at the course directory, it's a good idea to visit 'START HERE' for 
a course orientation video. Once you’re done, dive straight into 101 by 
clicking on the 101 icon.

If that doesn't work, please check that you are logged in. You will see 
a 'Sign in' tab in the top right of the screen if you’re /not/ logged in.

You are entitled to join our ‘Genius' Facebook Group which is exclusive 
to paid students of this course. It is a valuable part of your enrolment 
and it should be your first port of call for any questions you have.

You can apply to join by clicking here 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5255644826959872/4946397635936256>. 
You'll be asked a question when you join, this helps our mods verify you 
are an enrolled student of 101. Here is the question and the response 
you should use:

Q. What is the name of James's new golden retriever puppy?

*A. Enzo*

You are also now a member of the Self Publishing Formula University 
(SPFU). This will include regular live webinars with instructional areas 
on the latest areas of interest for writers. Recordings of the webinars 
are available in the course directory area.

If you have any technical issues or problems with the course, you can 
try posting in Genius for answers or alternatively contact us direct via 
our support email:

support@selfpublishingformula.com <mailto:support@selfpublishingformula.com>

You are entitled to a great set of VIP Bonuses. Most will be issued via 
email (and posted in the course curriculum) around 17th May 2021. 
However, a few are available right away.

BOOKFUNNEL has fast become an essential tool for authors and we know you 
might want to get started right away. We are making the discount code 
available now. Click the following link for your exclusive offer, $50 
off your first year + a free month.

/https://bookfunnel.com/2021spring-sp101/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/6470910051221504/4946397635936256>/

The offer expires on June 30th 2021.

You will also find a course exclusive bonus to PublisherRocket (covered 
in module 2, session 5), here: 
https://rocket.thrivecart.com/publisher-rocket-special/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5181103991816192/4946397635936256>

That's it for now. I'll be in the Genius group as much as I can, so 
please pop in and say hello!

It's great to have you onboard.

*Best wishes,*

*Mark.*

Profile Image 	*Mark Dawson*
Chief Scribbler
Self Publishing Formula Ltd
mark@selfpublishingformula.com
www.selfpublishingformula.com <http://www.selfpublishingformula.com>

Unsubscribe 
<https://mo349.infusionsoft.com/app/linkClick/77414/a3254b91eb5989c0/76336236/022159ef6266e532>

Self Publishing Formula Ltd Windover House St. Ann Street Salisbury, 
Wiltshire SP1 2DR United Kingdom

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WonderCon 2022 Professional Badge Confirmation - Order Number: 
79873
Date: 	Tue, 22 Mar 2022 01:31:10 +0000 (UTC)
From: 	donotreply@comic-con.org
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

*INDUSTRY - HALL D*

*WonderCon 2022 Badge Confirmation
/April 1-3, 2022
/*

    Badges

Registrant 	Todd J. McCaffrey
Registration Type 	Professional
Badge Number 	791443759

Hello Todd J.,

We’re so excited to have you join us for WonderCon 2022! Please bring 
this confirmation and a valid photo ID on-site to pick up your badge. In 
addition to wearing an approved face covering, you will be required to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status _or_ proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken within 48 hours for a PCR test or within 24 
hours for an antigen test. Click here 
<https://www.comic-con.org/wca/covid-19-faq> for more information.

*REMINDER: You must pick up all badges associated with your order, 
including your guest badge (if any), using this barcode confirmation 
email. Guests will not be allowed to pick up their own badges. There 
will be no on-site "will call" for professional guests.*

This barcode confirmation is good for WonderCon 2022. You may not 
transfer, sell, and/or share your barcode confirmation. The name on your 
barcode confirmation must match your photo ID when you arrive on-site. 
Your order details can be found below.

Please keep this confirmation safe and secure. Do not duplicate or share 
your barcode confirmation with anyone else. If it is scanned on-site 
before you arrive, your barcode will not work, and you will not receive 
a badge.

    WonderCon Badge Pick-Up

Your WonderCon badge will be available for pick-up at the *Industry 
Registration Area* in *Hall D* of the Anaheim Convention Center: 800 W 
Katella Ave, Anaheim, CA, 92802. Please look for the designated *BLUE 
Industry line* when you arrive in Hall D. You will need this 
confirmation and a valid photo ID to pick up your badge.

*WonderCon Badge Pick-Up Hours*
Thursday (3/31)* 	12:00 PM - 7:00 PM
Friday (4/1) 	9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Saturday (4/2) 	8:30 AM - 7:00 PM
Sunday (4/3)
	8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

*Thursday hours are for badge pick-up *only*. There is no programming on 
Thursday, and the Exhibit Hall is closed.

Badge pick-up hours are subject to change. For the most current badge 
pick-up hours, please visit our website 
<https://comic-con.org/wca/professional-faq>.

    Child Badges

Children age 12 and under are free with a registered adult. You may 
register a child for a complimentary badge on-site at the *Registration 
Area*located in *Hall D*of the Anaheim Convention Center. All children 
will be required to follow the COVID-19 policy.

/Children must be present to be registered for a badge and you //will be 
required to provide emergency contact information for any child 
registrant./

    More Information

Please visit www.comic-con.org/wca <http://www.comic-con.org/wca> for 
information on hotel reservations, directions, parking, and public 
transportation. Parking and traffic can be a challenge if you are not 
prepared.

    The Fine Print

*Terms and Conditions*
By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status or proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken on or after Wednesday, March 30. WonderCon 
reserves the right to modify requirements or limits for attending or 
participating in Activities.

By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree not 
to sell, trade, transfer or share your complimentary code, badge 
confirmation, or badge. In the event that San Diego Comic 
Convention/WonderCon/Comic-Con International (SDCC) determines that you 
have violated this policy, SDCC has the right to cancel your entire 
badge order and keep any money paid by you. Confirmations and/or badges 
that have been sold or provided by anyone other than SDCC will not be 
honored by SDCC. You must wear and display your badge at all times while 
onsite and at any official SDCC event.

All badges are the property of SDCC and must be relinquished to SDCC 
upon request. SDCC reserves the right to refuse admission, to refuse 
service, and/or to cancel/revoke your Member ID and/or badge at SDCC's 
discretion.

We encourage you to review the full WonderCon badge purchase Terms & 
Conditions at https://www.comic-con.org/wca/terms-and-conditions

Comic-Con International

date: Wed, 05 Oct 2022 18:09:14 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Monique Bucheger<monique.bucheger@gmail.com>
subject: Re: Trouble Blows West

Body:
Hi Monique,

Thank you for your patience, I read Trouble Blows West.

It did not work for me.  Permit me to emphasize, it did not work for *me.*
*
*
Here's why the book didn't work for me:

Ginny's character just didn't seem real to me.  It became less so as the 
book progressed. Her mounting anger and vengeance didn't have any 
rational background to support them and her unwillingness to listen to 
reason or learn finally killed any sympathy I might have had for her.

I also questioned the setting -- was this in the 1970s? 80s? 90s? 
Earlier? Later?

Ginny's love for her mare didn't work for me. I grew up with horse mad 
girls, and Ginny didn't fit.  It seemed to me that her horse was at 
about the same level in her affections as a rusted hand-me-down bicycle.

I began to notice the number of chapters.  There's an *awful* lot of them.

I also wasn't sure about the farm -- was it a cattle farm? Dairy? Crop? 
Mixed use?  That question nagged at me and helped pull me out of the book.

Cheers,
Todd McCaffrey

P.S.: The YA/Middle Grade books that I read include:

Ally Carter's /The Gallagher Girls/ 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000S1LF5K>
also Ally Carter's Winterborne Home for Vengeance and Valor 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07T4HQR9D>
Alan Bradley started a marvelous series about an eleven year-old sleuth 
with The Sweetness at the Bottom of the Pie 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0027G6XDS>
L.A. Meyer produced the amazing Bloody Jack 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003K16PPU> series.
Also, Carlos Hernandez knocked it out of the park with Sal and Gabi 
Break the Universe <https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FL82MKG> which is 
currently an Amazon #1 Best Seller

to: <submissions@galaxysedge.com>
subject: Re: Reprints for Galaxy's Edge

Body:
Dear Martin,

Wow, congratulations!

I'm attaching two - "Golden" and "Red." They are two fantasy dragon 
stories, the second a sequel to the first (they are two others planned: 
"Green" and "Pyrate Queen").  I tend to work in Google Docs nowadays but 
I've converted them to Word .docs format for you.

Also, have you considered checking in with Dean Wesley Smith and 
Kristine Kathryn Rusch?

I've got a question: who's doing reviews of books and can I submit one 
(or more) for perusal? Also, in what format (I'm talking published books 
and could just send an eBook "Amazon Gift").  I ask because I'm thinking 
of launching a Kickstarter campaign for a sequel to one of my books 
("The Steam Walker") and I was thinking it'd be great if I could 
reference a book review.

Cheers,
Todd

Subject: Fwd: A/C woes

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Re: A/C woes
Date: 	Thu, 17 Jun 2021 12:00:14 -0700
From: 	Kenneth Lee <klee10026@gmail.com>
To: 	todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,

I am sorry you still have issues with the AC unit. I thought the last 
time Hot Cold Air came out, they had fixed all the problems.

I have forwarded your message to them and asked for a solution. 
Hopefully they can send a knowledgeable technician to take care of it 
once for all. I will keep you posted.

----------------
Best Regards,
Kenneth
(702) 580-0968
klee10026@gmail.com <mailto:klee10026@gmail.com>

On Wed, Jun 16, 2021 at 8:42 PM todd <todd@toddwriter.com 
<mailto:todd@toddwriter.com>> wrote:

    Dear Mr Lee,

    I would like to request someone to fix the A/C. Here is the situation.
    The A/C system is one condenser with two internal thermostats, one
    upstairs and one down stairs. There is a damper, which is movable flap
    inside the duct work that directs air flow downstair or upstairs
    depending on the settings of the thermostat.

    At some point in time in the past one of the thermostats was
    disconnected and so the damper does not adjust airflow, since there is
    only one thermostat attached.

    I would like to get the second thermostat reconnected and confirm the
    damper is working correctly to cool both floors as soon as possible.

    As it is right now, the AC is running continuously. Even when the
    system
    is turned OFF, the fans still run. When the system is set to COOL, the
    thermostat setting downstairs has no effect -- and the system runs
    continuously, without regards to temperature (the temperature has been
    68 when the thermostat was set to 72), nothing short of turning the AC
    to OFF on the thermostat effects that (and, as I said, even then the
    fans continue to run). None of this can be good for the AC system.

    At this very moment, my room temperature is 79.3 degrees which is
    intolerable.

    I look forward to hearing from you immediately.

    Sincerely,
    Todd McCaffrey

subject: Fwd: Weyr Search e-copy?

Body:
FYI

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Weyr Search e-copy?
Date: 	Tue, 7 Jan 2020 16:46:19 -0500
From: 	Trevor Quachri <tquachri@dellmagazines.net>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com
CC: 	Emily Hockaday <ehockaday@dellmagazines.net>

Hi Todd,

As part of ANALOG’s 90th anniversary year in 2020, we’re breaking our 
“no reprints” rule and running retrospectives on a handful of stories 
that someone close to the magazine feels a particularly strong personal 
connection to. Emily Hockaday, our Managing Editor (who has been with us 
nearly a decade), picked “Weyr Search,” for its formative effect on her 
as a young reader. I’m writing 1) just to give you a friendly heads-up; 
I’ve already reached out to Vaughne Hansen at Virginia Kidd with the 
paperwork, and 2) to ask if you might have an electronic version of the 
story you’d be able to provide us?

Best,
Trevor

Trevor Quachri
Editor,
ANALOG SCIENCE FICTION AND FACT

subject: Fwd: For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman

Body:
FYI :)

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by 
Steven-Elliot Altman
Date: 	Thu, 11 Feb 2021 04:31:01 +0500
From: 	Steve Altman <steve@socialimpulse.com>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

Hey Todd,

Steve Altman here. Hope this email finds you well, it's been awhile, and 
I pray we all get to meet up at conventions again. <sigh>

In the meantime, please forgive my shameless promotion here. I'm gunning 
for recommendations for my last History channel videogame, /Project Blue 
Book/ with little or no guidance and have drummed up this post on the 
SFWA board. For amplification purposes I am sending it out to certain 
SFWA members who may be interested in playing and/or reading the game's 
script for consideration. Hope you won't mind being on my list. Did you 
happen to catch the TV series? Well worth watching.

Here is an overview of *Project Blue Book: The Game* with the attached 
game script for your consideration (as well as some smaller samples) and 
links to play the game for free. Enjoy!

The information below has been posted in its entirety on the Members 
Only SFWA message boards at the following link, and should be treated 
confidentially: 
https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/>

Project Blue Book The Game Image 2.png

Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman and Julie Marsh

Please find attached the Final Production Draft of Project Blue Book: 
The Game, which I wrote for A&E Networks based on their History Channel 
series, along with my clue writer Julie Marsh (Julie was not credited on 
the game itself, as I was featured, but I am compelled to include her 
for consideration due to her essential contributions).

I was attempting to bring the genres of television writing and videogame 
writing one step closer. I was given nearly free reign by the network 
and showrunners on how to proceed, and so decided to write my own 
adaptations of half the game's cases based on produced episodes of the 
TV series (with additional scenes that I envisioned) and the other half 
of the cases as original cases which I based on actual declassified 
U.S.A.F Project Blue Book files.

The Production Draft encompasses all 9 Cases of Season One of the game. 
Because this document is quite lengthy I have also attached "Case 105: 
The Aztec Recovery" (in which I introduce J. Robert Oppenheimer to the 
game's story) and "Case 107: Project Rainbow" (in which I 
introduce Albert Einstein to the game's story, in a story previously 
dramatized as the feature film /The Philadelphia Experiment/) as two 
smaller samples of the complete work.

Besides the script, the game is FREE TO PLAY as a mobile app available 
for both IOS and Android phones and tablets in the safe links listed 
below, and I invite you to play!

Project Blue Book: The Game on IOS 
<https://apps.apple.com/us/app/project-blue-book-the-game/id1445162277>

Project Blue Book: The Game on Android 
<https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.threegates.projectbluebook&hl=en_US>

And for anyone who does not wish to actually play the game, here are 
two youtube videos posted by players that depict the game's opening 
tutorial, and the start of CASE 101, The Fuller Dogfight.

Project Blue Book Opening Cut Scene and Tutorial 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFhBUpUeqsE&t=5s>

Project Blue Book Case 101 Walkthrough 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OOhAgdjG7bY&t=23s>

And finally, here is the approved description from the app store:

Project Blue Book: The Game is the official, free-to-play, hidden object 
adventure game based on HISTORY’s hit drama series PROJECT BLUE BOOK, 
created by David O'Leary, and executive produced by Academy Award and 
Golden Globe® winner Robert Zemeckis. The series explores the 
historical, Top Secret investigations into UFOs conducted by the U.S. 
Air Force between 1952 and 1969.

In Project Blue Book: The Game, you will start off as a newly recruited 
agent in Project Blue Book during the 1950s, under the guidance of the 
show's lead investigators, Dr. J. Allen Hynek (played by Aidan Gillen 
from “Game Of Thrones”), and Captain Michael Quinn (played by Michael 
Malarkey from “The Vampire Diaries”), and begin to investigate real 
declassified UFO investigations to find the truth!

Hundreds of puzzles, witness interviews and hidden object scenes will 
challenge your observation and deduction tactics as you investigate 
alongside your favorite characters into many of the cases you loved from 
the series, uncover exclusive new content, and explore new cases that 
can only be found in the game! The game's story is written by 
bestselling science-fiction writer and award-winning game writer 
Steven-Elliot Altman, best known for similar social games like PEARL’S 
PERIL and ANCIENT ALIENS.

We're here to find the truth! So, come help us investigate flying 
saucers along with Dr. Hynek in the world's first Unidentified Flying 
(Hidden) Object Game!

Thank you for considering *Project Blue Book: The Game* for a Nebula 
Nomination in the best game writing category. Should you wish to 
nominate it, here is the SFWA link: https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/>

Love and light to you and your family,
Steve

*Steven-Elliot Altman*
Chief Executive Officer

  Phone  +1 (323) 708-9005
  Fax       +1 (877) 581-8750
  Site Socialimpulse.com <http://Socialimpulse.com>

date: Tue, 12 May 2020 08:29:11 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Geoff Hilton<red.van@btinternet.com>
subject: Masks? Really?

Body:
Hi Geoff,

Welcome to the weird world of 2020!

Who would have predicted last year that the new fashion rage would be masks?

Of course, masks are really good at protecting others from your germs, 
not so much for protecting you from their germs (but a bit).

We're all right here in Vegas.  The life of a writer pretty much means 
that I'm mostly working from home anyway, although I do miss dropping 
into Starbucks and typing away there.

I hope you, Irma, and all the kids are okay.  I got worried when I 
realized that you'd planned for practically a world tour to visit the 
various far flung offspring.

I spent my 64th birthday at home and spent a lot of maudlin time 
thinking of the Beatles' "When I'm 64."  But the mood wore off soon 
enough and now I'm not feeling all that much different from 60.

I *have*, however, been planning on dropping you a line for months.  
Every night, as I'm drifting off, I'd say to myself "must write Geoff" 
-- well, finally I've done it!

Anyway, cheers, hang in there and I hope all is well with you and yours!

Cheers,

Todd

date: Sat, 27 Feb 2021 11:02:07 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: <opinion@nytimes.com>
subject: Op-Ed: How I didn't become a racist

Body:
**

*How I didn’t become a racist*

*

By Todd McCaffrey, BSME, MFA, SFWA, New York Times Bestselling author

I think it’s important to understand America’s underlying inclination 
toward racism. It doesn’t just come from our parents. It comes from our 
community, our society, from the people we grow up with.

I am an alien, so I think my point of view may be helpful. When I say 
I’m an alien, I’m an alien in Ireland: where I lived for my high school 
and college years. I describe myself as “mid-Atlantic and sinking.”

My journey toward racism started in late elementary and early middle 
school, before I moved to Ireland.

I moved to Long Island, New York, in time to enter third grade. The 
school was small and the community tight-knit. There were only two black 
kids in the whole school — they were brothers, a year apart. Nice guys. 
The younger one had a small bit of iris detached in the white of his eye 
which amazed everyone who saw it.  I remember constantly asking to look 
at it — it was just so cool!

My parents were determined to raise broad-minded children and when the 
chance came, introduced us to people from all  over the world, including 
a Nigerian who stayed the weekend with us, arriving in the marvelously 
bright Nigerian native clothing.

Still, in school hallways, there were the whispers. That blacks would 
beat kids up, that you couldn’t trust them.

This whispering became more apparent in middle school and I think, had 
it not been for my relocation to Ireland, that background whispering 
would have lodged firmly in my mind.

But, barring that lingering underlayer of fear, I like to think that the 
full implant of racism didn’t take with me.  And I think that’s because 
of my time in Ireland… and two people in particular.

In Ireland my classmates said: “I hate all Yanks!” to which was hastily 
added, “But not you, I know you.”  Such statements are examples of 
prejudice and bigotry. It was my first experience of prejudice directed 
at me.

The two people who broke the back of racism for me were strangers.  One 
was a classmate, the other an actor.

We’ll take the second first.  He is Lenny Henry — now SirLenny Henry.  
He is a black comedian. Hearing a very English accent on a black man 
broke the mold that society had tried to impose on me about black people 
— that they all spoke the same.  That was a revelation to me, a “Wait, 
what?” moment. Not all blacks are the same.  My fourteen year-old 
thinking went like this: “So… this notion that blacks are a threat or 
menace… that’s a lie!”

My second revelation came with my classmate, Obudan Obesan. Obudan, for 
me, will always be the primal proof that skin color means 
absolutelynothing!  Also, he proved that James Joyce was a second-rate 
author. I can’t remember when we read Joyce’s The Dubliners.  I’m pretty 
sure it was after I’d first been exposed to Mr. Obesan’s writing.  The 
thing is, Obudan gotthe feel of the Irish, the Dublin Irish, down pat.  
He had it better than Joyce. Waayyybetter than Joyce. Nearly fifty years 
later, my opinion has not changed.

Between Obudan and Sir Lenny Henry, I threw out that notion that black 
people were inferior.

With the benefit of hindsight, I can see how American society has a 
built-in underlying prejudice against people of color.  It starts as the 
whispers in middle grade and high school corridors: “You can’t trust 
them.” “They’ll beat you up.” It’s something that we should be aware of, 
should recognize... and banish.

Because black culture has imbued our society with somuch. Even while we 
derided it, it gave us rock’n’roll, starting with Chuck Berry. The black 
culture is more vibrant and alive than the old, tired white culture. We 
can and should learn a lot from it.  The first step is to recognize 
that. The next step is to embrace this difference, to grasp it and learn 
from it. Our society will grow stronger when we do.

*

Your Welcome Message from Mark Dawson
image

*Hello!*

A huge welcome to Self Publishing 101.

Self publishing can be complicated and confusing and I want this course 
to be your easy-to-follow and comprehensive guide to what you need to 
have in place in order to thrive as an independent author.

This email contains important information - please save it for future 
reference.

The course materials can be accessed at this address:

https://selfpublishingformula.com/mycourses 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/4698703130132480/4946397635936256>

Please bookmark this link.

Once at the course directory, it's a good idea to visit 'START HERE' for 
a course orientation video. Once you’re done, dive straight into 101 by 
clicking on the 101 icon.

If that doesn't work, please check that you are logged in. You will see 
a 'Sign in' tab in the top right of the screen if you’re /not/ logged in.

You are entitled to join our ‘Genius' Facebook Group which is exclusive 
to paid students of this course. It is a valuable part of your enrolment 
and it should be your first port of call for any questions you have.

You can apply to join by clicking here 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5255644826959872/4946397635936256>. 
You'll be asked a question when you join, this helps our mods verify you 
are an enrolled student of 101. Here is the question and the response 
you should use:

Q. What is the name of James's new golden retriever puppy?

*A. Enzo*

You are also now a member of the Self Publishing Formula University 
(SPFU). This will include regular live webinars with instructional areas 
on the latest areas of interest for writers. Recordings of the webinars 
are available in the course directory area.

If you have any technical issues or problems with the course, you can 
try posting in Genius for answers or alternatively contact us direct via 
our support email:

support@selfpublishingformula.com <mailto:support@selfpublishingformula.com>

You are entitled to a great set of VIP Bonuses. Most will be issued via 
email (and posted in the course curriculum) around 17th May 2021. 
However, a few are available right away.

BOOKFUNNEL has fast become an essential tool for authors and we know you 
might want to get started right away. We are making the discount code 
available now. Click the following link for your exclusive offer, $50 
off your first year + a free month.

/https://bookfunnel.com/2021spring-sp101/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/6470910051221504/4946397635936256>/

The offer expires on June 30th 2021.

You will also find a course exclusive bonus to PublisherRocket (covered 
in module 2, session 5), here: 
https://rocket.thrivecart.com/publisher-rocket-special/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5181103991816192/4946397635936256>

That's it for now. I'll be in the Genius group as much as I can, so 
please pop in and say hello!

It's great to have you onboard.

*Best wishes,*

*Mark.*

Subject: Alec

Body:
Dear Jay,

I had a long chat with Amelia last night.

I am /so sorry/ that you are having to deal with constant calls from 
Alec. I know that's got to be hard and I'm afraid I can't see any way to 
make things easier for anyone but I did want to say thank you for all 
your efforts, your kindness, and your generosity in dealing with this.  
You are acting above and beyond the call of duty and I wanted you to 
know that I recognize it and am grateful.

Cheers,

Todd

The Freedom Scientific Software Licensing Team

subject: Horoscopes!

Body:
Georgia Nicols 
<http://go.sparkpostmail.com/f/a/SZxgcnDTLSeY-H3WSHmztA~~/AABzeAA~/RgRgM3oaP0QdaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ2VvcmdpYW5pY29scy5jb21XA3NwY0IKAACaRlJe7Be701ITdG9kZEB0b2Rkd3JpdGVyLmNvbVgEAAAAAA~~>

  Weekly Horoscope: Sunday, February 23, 2020

    Pisces (Feb. 19-March 20)

Well, this continues to be an interesting time for you because you are 
empowered and energizes with the Sun in your sign! This is a good thing. 
It will attract people and favourable situations to you. (We like!) 
However, Mercury Retrograde is also in your sign! This is like a magnet 
for goofy situations. Misplaced items, forgotten appointments, delays, 
little frustrations, confused communications, and a general sense of 
feeling disorganized will create obstacles for you. Because Mars is in 
your House of Friendships, be careful you don't take your frustrations 
out on a friend. Chill out. Meanwhile, the good news is that Venus will 
attract money to you. It will also encourage you to buy beautiful things 
for yourself and loved ones. It might even attract new ways to earn 
money? Yes!

  Horoscopes by Holiday: Feb. 23, 2020 by Holiday Mathis

*PISCES* (Feb. 19-March 20). Time will reveal the difference between a 
beneficial and a detrimental distraction. What’s good for one era of 
life brings little benefit to another era. You’ll intuitively find the 
right thing to chase at the right time.

*TODAY’S BIRTHDAY* (Feb. 23). Funding comes for a project, and soon 
after you’ll enter a brief period of wonderful solo interior discovery. 
Your focus on unraveling a problem will end in an exciting breakthrough 
and fresh interest. Then you will love – go all-in. And then it’s 
springtime, your whole heart wide as fields, alive in flowers and 
buzzing bees. Scorpio and Leo adore you. Your lucky numbers are: 4, 48, 
22, 5 and 39.

*CELEBRITY PROFILES*: It has been announced that Dakota Fanning will 
star in “The Bell Jar,” an adaptation of the Sylvia Plath novel about a 
young woman struggling with mental illness. Fanning was born when the 
sun, Venus and Saturn were all in artistic and empathetic Pisces. Her 
natal moon is in Leo, the sign of entertainment, and her natal Mercury 
and Mars shine from intellectually and socially savvy Aquarius.

Happy birthday!

Love,

Dad

Todd

Subject: Re: Trouble Blows West

Body:
Hi Monique,

Thank you for your patience, I read Trouble Blows West.

It did not work for me.  Permit me to emphasize, it did not work for *me.*
*
*
Here's why the book didn't work for me:

Ginny's character just didn't seem real to me.  It became less so as the 
book progressed. Her mounting anger and vengeance didn't have any 
rational background to support them and her unwillingness to listen to 
reason or learn finally killed any sympathy I might have had for her.

I also questioned the setting -- was this in the 1970s? 80s? 90s? 
Earlier? Later?

Ginny's love for her mare didn't work for me. I grew up with horse mad 
girls, and Ginny didn't fit.  It seemed to me that her horse was at 
about the same level in her affections as a rusted hand-me-down bicycle.

I began to notice the number of chapters.  There's an *awful* lot of them.

I also wasn't sure about the farm -- was it a cattle farm? Dairy? Crop? 
Mixed use?  That question nagged at me and helped pull me out of the book.

Cheers,
Todd McCaffrey

P.S.: The YA/Middle Grade books that I read include:

Ally Carter's /The Gallagher Girls/ 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000S1LF5K>
also Ally Carter's Winterborne Home for Vengeance and Valor 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07T4HQR9D>
Alan Bradley started a marvelous series about an eleven year-old sleuth 
with The Sweetness at the Bottom of the Pie 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0027G6XDS>
L.A. Meyer produced the amazing Bloody Jack 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003K16PPU> series.
Also, Carlos Hernandez knocked it out of the park with Sal and Gabi 
Break the Universe <https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FL82MKG> which is 
currently an Amazon #1 Best Seller

date: Fri, 19 Feb 2021 17:25:31 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: <Dave.Chesson@gmail.com>
subject: WonderCon Panel: How to Create Your Own Novel: From First Idea to Publishing and What You Need to Sell Your Work Into TV and Film

Body:
Hi Dave,

Here's what we did at San Diego Comic-Con (the virtual Comic-Con) last year:

**

*How to Create Your Own Novel: From the first idea to publishing and 
what you need to sell your work to TV and Film*

*

The Winner Twins, Brittany and Brianna, multiple award-winning and 
national-bestselling science fiction and fantasy authors, will explain 
how to create your own novel step by step, from building your universe 
to overcoming writer's block to the different paths to publishing. They 
will be joined by Todd McCaffrey (New York Times bestselling author, 
Dragonriders of Pern), Kevin J Anderson (New York Times bestselling 
author and publisher of Wordfire Press, The Saga of Seven Suns, The Star 
Wars Universe, The Dune Universe), and Rebecca Moesta 
(national-bestselling author, publisher and CEO of Wordfire Press, Buffy 
the Vampire Slayer, Junior Jedi Knights, A Christmas to Remember). They 
will share their war stories, their writing secrets, and discuss their 
insights and advice on writing through the Covid-19 era.

*

*You can watch the reult on Youtube:
*

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kiwNrnvStJ0 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kiwNrnvStJ0>*

*

Our thought we be to bring you into the conversation when we talk about 
indie publishing.

Cheers,

Todd

*

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WonderCon 2022 Professional Badge Confirmation - Order Number: 
79873
Date: 	Tue, 22 Mar 2022 01:31:10 +0000 (UTC)
From: 	donotreply@comic-con.org
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

*INDUSTRY - HALL D*

*WonderCon 2022 Badge Confirmation
/April 1-3, 2022
/*

    Badges

Registrant 	Todd J. McCaffrey
Registration Type 	Professional
Badge Number 	791443759

Hello Todd J.,

We’re so excited to have you join us for WonderCon 2022! Please bring 
this confirmation and a valid photo ID on-site to pick up your badge. In 
addition to wearing an approved face covering, you will be required to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status _or_ proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken within 48 hours for a PCR test or within 24 
hours for an antigen test. Click here 
<https://www.comic-con.org/wca/covid-19-faq> for more information.

*REMINDER: You must pick up all badges associated with your order, 
including your guest badge (if any), using this barcode confirmation 
email. Guests will not be allowed to pick up their own badges. There 
will be no on-site "will call" for professional guests.*

This barcode confirmation is good for WonderCon 2022. You may not 
transfer, sell, and/or share your barcode confirmation. The name on your 
barcode confirmation must match your photo ID when you arrive on-site. 
Your order details can be found below.

Please keep this confirmation safe and secure. Do not duplicate or share 
your barcode confirmation with anyone else. If it is scanned on-site 
before you arrive, your barcode will not work, and you will not receive 
a badge.

    WonderCon Badge Pick-Up

Your WonderCon badge will be available for pick-up at the *Industry 
Registration Area* in *Hall D* of the Anaheim Convention Center: 800 W 
Katella Ave, Anaheim, CA, 92802. Please look for the designated *BLUE 
Industry line* when you arrive in Hall D. You will need this 
confirmation and a valid photo ID to pick up your badge.

*WonderCon Badge Pick-Up Hours*
Thursday (3/31)* 	12:00 PM - 7:00 PM
Friday (4/1) 	9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Saturday (4/2) 	8:30 AM - 7:00 PM
Sunday (4/3)
	8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

*Thursday hours are for badge pick-up *only*. There is no programming on 
Thursday, and the Exhibit Hall is closed.

Badge pick-up hours are subject to change. For the most current badge 
pick-up hours, please visit our website 
<https://comic-con.org/wca/professional-faq>.

    Child Badges

Children age 12 and under are free with a registered adult. You may 
register a child for a complimentary badge on-site at the *Registration 
Area*located in *Hall D*of the Anaheim Convention Center. All children 
will be required to follow the COVID-19 policy.

/Children must be present to be registered for a badge and you //will be 
required to provide emergency contact information for any child 
registrant./

    More Information

Please visit www.comic-con.org/wca <http://www.comic-con.org/wca> for 
information on hotel reservations, directions, parking, and public 
transportation. Parking and traffic can be a challenge if you are not 
prepared.

    The Fine Print

*Terms and Conditions*
By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status or proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken on or after Wednesday, March 30. WonderCon 
reserves the right to modify requirements or limits for attending or 
participating in Activities.

By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree not 
to sell, trade, transfer or share your complimentary code, badge 
confirmation, or badge. In the event that San Diego Comic 
Convention/WonderCon/Comic-Con International (SDCC) determines that you 
have violated this policy, SDCC has the right to cancel your entire 
badge order and keep any money paid by you. Confirmations and/or badges 
that have been sold or provided by anyone other than SDCC will not be 
honored by SDCC. You must wear and display your badge at all times while 
onsite and at any official SDCC event.

All badges are the property of SDCC and must be relinquished to SDCC 
upon request. SDCC reserves the right to refuse admission, to refuse 
service, and/or to cancel/revoke your Member ID and/or badge at SDCC's 
discretion.

We encourage you to review the full WonderCon badge purchase Terms & 
Conditions at https://www.comic-con.org/wca/terms-and-conditions

Comic-Con International

------------------------------------------------------------------------

To: 	us@oddballauthors.com

Hello,

Congratulations, your book “71 Seconds To Funding” is now live and

Here are additional resources to help you promote your book and reach

Subject: Fwd: Reader guidelines or Magpie’s War

Body:
FYI

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Re: Reader guidelines or Magpie’s War
Date: 	Thu, 18 Mar 2021 12:43:12 -1000
From: 	Stephanie Gayron <sgteach14@att.net>
To: 	todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,
I wanted to let you know how much I am enjoying Magpie’s War. I am 60% 
finished which I am sure you are disappointed in my progress as I am, 
but I am busy here and my reading is usually only in the evening. 
Everything works. For me the middle of the book is the most gripping as 
the story moves along much more quickly than the beginning. I am sure 
this is because the reader is being introduced to the characters and the 
setting. We are in Maui now and as I write, I am reading. Question about 
ley lines. Please clarify what they are and the significance in the 
story, since the closest I can come is Wikipedia- Ley (landform) name 
for a crag, rock of cliff in the North German language area.

Stephanie
Keep your eyes on eternity!

date: Fri, 08 May 2020 13:55:09 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Kenneth Lee<klee10026@gmail.com>
subject: Re: Renewal for 7861 Dell Ridge Ave.

Body:
Mr. Lee,

Thank you for your email. I certainly hope that you and yours are safe 
and sound during this crisis.

The unemployment news today shows that we are in a crisis greater than 
the Great Recession and nearly as bad (or, perhaps, worse) than the 
Great Depression.  Las Vegas is particularly hard hit and will take 
longer to recover because this city gets so much of its revenue from the 
entertainment industry.

I do not believe that this is a time for increasing rent.

Sincerely

Todd McCaffrey

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	SFR 2020!
Date: 	Sat, 30 Jan 2021 23:52:27 +0000
From: 	Alex Newton (K-lytics) <news@k-lytics.com>
Reply-To: 	news@k-lytics.com
To: 	Todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,

At first sight, science fiction and romance seem to be genres that are 
not compatible. For the most part they are, if you examine the 
demographics of the majority of readers in the two categories.

But that does not prevent individual writers from bringing the two 
genres together and doing incredibly well with it.

Sci-Fi Romance was one of the first niche market reports based on our 
"Virtual Besteller List" approach that we published back in 2016. In the 
meantime, the category has grown into a significant market.

Traditional publishers have left money on the table while indie authors 
have conquered the space (both figuratively and literally).

Both sci-fi and romance provide escapism to readers during these 
challenging times. So if you can imagine writing a story about 
intergalactic love, warring species, hunky alien heroes — blue, purple, 
and fiercely protective or possessive of their women — then look no further.

Research less, write more! Learn more:

date: Tue, 20 Jul 2021 19:57:57 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: David Weber<davidweber@davidweber.net>
subject: Thank you!

Body:
Hi David,

Thank you for getting me a copy of "A Call to Insurrection!"

it was much enjoyed!

One niggle -- at the end of the last book, Calvingdell and Locatelli are 
involved in a coin toss over who gets Travis. I  do wish that had been 
explicitly resolved.

It's nice to see Travis and Gavin communicating.

The situation with Serisburg seemed to beg for a bit more preamble and I 
thought Chomps might have been a lot quicker on the up-take. I think I 
also would have liked to see more personalities involved in the 
ONI/Delphi clash.

Even though I've seen them both before, I got a bit muddled with 
Damocles and Diacritos -- both being D names. I would have loved a bit 
more of "the courier ship, Diacritos" to keep them clear.

I do certainly look forward to more!

Cheers,

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Reminder: Action Required Regarding Your AmazonSmile Charity 
Selection
Date: 	Thu, 5 Mar 2020 06:47:12 +0000
From: 	no-reply@amazon.com
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

AmazonSmile 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=19NA8SQ79PZIM&K=824R9N5NCP1B&M=urn:rtn:msg:202003050647126ac73f838cfa479bacc5276aac40p0na&R=21VYJDUL5WI24&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fsmile.amazon.com%3Fref_%3Dpe_2466700_168532830&H=UPXHYV9Z5MVFQJUAXFMAOYES5UOA&ref_=pe_2466700_168532830> 

Dear Todd J. McCaffrey:

You are receiving this email because the AmazonSmile charity you are 
supporting, Motivate 2 Learn (EIN: 27-0664968), has not provided 
AmazonSmile with its bank account information and therefore we have been 
unable to issue AmazonSmile donations to this organization. We have also 
reached out to Motivate 2 Learn (EIN: 27-0664968) to request 
registration completion to enable receipt of donations.

Since we have not successfully been able to issue the donations based on 
your previous AmazonSmile purchases, we have been holding these 
donations. You have until 02/22/20 to select a different charity to 
support and Amazon will issue the donation amount generated as a result 
of your previous purchases to the new charity you select. If you do not 
select a different charitable organization to support by 02/22/20 we 
will reallocate the donation amount proportionately to other
