date: Thu, 30 Apr 2020 13:51:59 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: jeff@f8ventures.com<jeff@f8ventures.com>
subject: Fwd: Re: Renewal for 7861 Dell Ridge Ave.

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Re: Renewal for 7861 Dell Ridge Ave.
Date: 	Thu, 30 Apr 2020 11:24:18 -0700
From: 	Kenneth Lee <klee10026@gmail.com>
To: 	todd <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,

Sorry to take so long to get back to you. Per my friend's request, I 
need to do a research about the rental market in your area.

You have been living at 7861 Dell Ridge for almost two years. The owner 
didn't rise the rent last year. He is thinking to do it this year, $100.

There are not a lot of rental properties which similar to yours in that 
area. And the rental price has been going up quite a bit last year. But 
when I consider you as a valid tenant, I think $100 increase is kind of 
too much. So I have suggested to the owner for $50. After the discussion 
with his wife, they finally agree the $50 increase.

If you are okay to accept the offer, I can go ahead to daft up the 
addendum. Thank you for your patience.

BTW - They are not thinking to sell the house in the near future.

----------------
Best Regards,
Kenneth
(702) 580-0968
klee10026@gmail.com <mailto:klee10026@gmail.com>

On Tue, Apr 28, 2020 at 7:53 PM todd <todd@toddwriter.com 
<mailto:todd@toddwriter.com>> wrote:

    Mr. Lee

    In these trying times we are all facing uncertainty. I would like to
    know if the owners intention is to re-lease the house, sell it or
    otherwise. I texted you last week requesting an update on releasing
    and have not received an answer, which is somewhat disconcerting. It
    is a very simple question which should not require much deliberation.

    If the owners intention is to sell the home I am interested in
    discussing that option as well. Given the virus and all the
    ramifications I really need to know what is happening ASAP please.

    Sincerely,

    Todd McCaffrey

*Darryl Owens* just submitted your form: Contact
on Winner Twins 
<http://links.crm.wix.com/ls/click?upn=NF0xrC6l-2FJE4TzUrHsONwgh9UbQuoiE4UpVIJgVg6EVCqK0NILhwPmi4jpNlBu4IO04n_qXHalVbVH5GuR4WtKz9OrH9KiNOHOrnbJOEOvIfIW-2FpOg39eRlQeGEzMHAKun-2Bc3fPJBbLwVAFYKzjO7p9qwvDApHP8NRwI0iB3OGP0UfogBw1ZTWsTGKa8FY0PXN0mmrqG9YiiB2dmiV-2FU85dJnHwuOf40QK8l8z9Oe7u9msMXDtBWoScS-2BICO5n2oLwK1e0X8t8-2FOTrRY9XFgwhDmPInegzpAs7OiaAO8g9KK3vJB9g6NVGCfl28RAlqeEf4Vqn49yY5ZVISS52G3oAifMHS7QV4zquyvXjShvNpiw1xX6Xy4tYq5ygHWJzPk51hkNkJUjcwSfLCrrYNZX7WmtUkGi5sYE9-2Fu01hgCtWHJzNGjIHZ2Kg4EZIa6K03hdVN-2BEauo6yJ9KfGc3DmynlS6PwxW-2BxNw-2BkulrFb8B-2FiGfYKiUaQcA3IS3wrt8Ysa-2Fy6BYsMUspuRsBjyJYnCCLyWXdfAhFDzTNDCnxZ54xnM8GAoO1JK06AnlxgyKRysJqSYGyvbpd3QDpNiFR9KYBd5bLNPD8PbUASExfSIMHxAo9sWMgExUOzjySvurWx8oqd1kSaIGcPqG2edJfUhIzC8qX9uTzDfMEQhKnExlJvf9y4AMt-2B0PO-2FTKeekvkewNe-2Bi>

Message Details:
First Name: Darryl
Last Name: Owens
Email: dowens@beaconcollege.edu
Phone: 3526389789
Message: Good day: Beacon College (https://www.BeaconCollege.edu) is a 
nonprofit liberal arts school in Leesburg, Florida and America’s first 
accredited baccalaureate institution dedicated to educating students 
primarily with learning disabilities, ADHD, dyslexia, and other learning 
differences. The college launched a television show in August 2020 
called “A World of Difference.” In each episode, “A World of Difference” 
examines neurodiversity issues related to learning disabilities 
experienced from birth to adult years, using compelling storytelling, 
conversations with experts, viewer Q&As and interviews with successful 
individuals with learning differences of their own. In just eight 
months’ time, the program has garnered a raft of honors including from 
the Education Digital Marketing Awards and PR News’ CSR Diversity Awards 
and has expanded (and continues to grow) its reach to 11 channels in 
eight states through regional, public, educational and governmental 
(PEG) stations. “A World of Difference” is available throughout the 
United States via public access TV channels, and is available globally 
via the college’s Facebook and YouTube channels. You can watch our most 
recent episode here: https://youtu.be/zmO9ef5iKxw One of the segments of 
which we’re most proud is “Difference Makers.” The feature salutes 
someone famous and/or successful who has a learning difference, or 
someone is a successful advocate for individuals with learning 
disabilities. We are interested in presenting The Winner Twins with our 
“Difference Maker” Award (https://beaconcollege.egnyte.com/dl/EsGCgOGdCL 
for their exceptional contributions to literature and their 
determination to succeed while living with learning differences, and the 
founding of Motivate2Learn. “A World of Difference” airs on WACX Orlando 
Superchannel 55 (which is available in 1 million Florida cable homes). 
It’s produced by a multiple-Telly Award and Emmy-nominated production 
company, NG Production Films. The show also is more widely available on 
our Facebook Watch and YouTube channels and the show’s website, 
https://www.AWODTV.org. More exciting, later this month we sign a 
contract to put the program into the PBS pipeline, airing soon on WUCF 
Orlando. Previous “Difference Makers” have included: • Dr. Temple 
Grandin • Retired U.S. Sen. Tom Harkin (the architect of the Americans 
with Disabilities Act) • Stanley Cup champion hockey player Brent Sopel 
• Shark Tank’s Daymond John You can view “Difference Maker” segments 
here: https://awodtv.org/category/difference-maker/ All that would be 
required of the Winner twins is for them to sit for an interview, either 
virtually or in-person (their choice), so we can create the segment. I 
look forward to hearing from you. Grace to you and peace, Darryl E. 
Owens Host/Creator Beacon College’s “A World of Difference” 352-638-9789 
phone 407-335-1455 mobile https://www.AWODTV.org
Phone 2: 3526389789

 

 

If you think this submission is spam, report it as spam 
<http://links.crm.wix.com/ls/click?upn=NF0xrC6l-2FJE4TzUrHsONwuaRjyhMOwt6ol-2F-2FJXWRq0uxcRElKs5TKuz2a2ZSTkqGlL9xQaw7HHpIfxmHK1wey-2FdWn0q38wGhq2affIlreWLRVF1wssd6HYRCmx5vifbh-Bav_qXHalVbVH5GuR4WtKz9OrH9KiNOHOrnbJOEOvIfIW-2FpOg39eRlQeGEzMHAKun-2Bc3fPJBbLwVAFYKzjO7p9qwvDApHP8NRwI0iB3OGP0UfogBw1ZTWsTGKa8FY0PXN0mmrqG9YiiB2dmiV-2FU85dJnHwuOf40QK8l8z9Oe7u9msMXDtBWoScS-2BICO5n2oLwK1e0X8t8-2FOTrRY9XFgwhDmPInegzpAs7OiaAO8g9KK3vJB9g6NVGCfl28RAlqeEf4Vqn49yY5ZVISS52G3oAifMHS7QV4zquyvXjShvNpiw1xX6Xy4tYq5ygHWJzPk51hkNkJUjcwSfLCrrYNZX7WmtUkGi5sYE9-2Fu01hgCtWHJzNGjIHZ2Kg4EZIa6K03hdVN-2BEauo6yJ9KfGc3DmynlS6PwxW-2BxNw-2BkulrFb8B-2FiGfYKiUaQcA3IS3wrt8Ysa-2Fy6BYsMUspuRsBjyJYnCCLyWXdfAhFDzTNDCnxZ54xnM8GDmvfcS2V32zdZ9i71auSShKCivYLzsbz38wPoGZ7gN3yPjxZknqL94P-2BxZpMUEM1euu-2BA5skLowBO4nj2HbEKHX7eRP6OSDrbJJzA3R05VKvr7RDI7ZSlYNxsrcTBmdRAVMPguKGox-2FJ6KIzjBie-2BA>.

electronically, if possible. I have sent you one link of Yodlee to 
connect your business checking account securely. please register on

            “The most intriguing depiction of a maturing artificial
            intelligence in science fiction. Scientists could learn a

She is an AI: artificial intelligence. The first. A mistake. She thinks 
a thousand times faster than a human. She’s tiny, bald, and transparent.

date: Mon, 15 Aug 2022 05:34:44 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Leah Wilson<leah@benbellabooks.com>
subject: Hello!

Body:
Hi Leah,

I hope you are well.  I have survived Covid, and am thriving in Las Vegas.

I am writing because, at San Diego Comic-Con this July, I thought that 
it'd be cool if I could have gotten some copies of Dragonwriter to sell 
at our booth (I sell copies of /Dragonholder/ there, too).  People still 
love Mum and I don't think enough of them know of /Dragonwriter./

Is there some sort of author discount and how do I get it?

In particular, I'm thinking of getting copies for FanX (Salt Lake, Sept 
22-24).

Cheers,

Todd McCaffrey

TODAY'S BIRTHDAY (Aug. 29). You're knowledgeable, but not too proud to 
utter the magic words "I don't know" so the world unfolds its grandeur 
at your feet. As you lead with curiosity, you'll keep everyone on their 
toes, increase communication and cooperation, and be instrumental in 
smooth operations. You'll be celebrated and paid well! Gemini and 
Sagittarius adore you. Your lucky numbers are: 9, 30, 29, 17 and 5.

subject: Renewal for 7861 Dell Ridge Ave.

Body:
Mr. Lee

In these trying times we are all facing uncertainty. I would like to 
know if the owners intention is to re-lease the house, sell it or 
otherwise. I texted you last week requesting an update on releasing and 
have not received an answer, which is somewhat disconcerting. It is a 
very simple question which should not require much deliberation.

If the owners intention is to sell the home I am interested in 
discussing that option as well. Given the virus and all the 
ramifications I really need to know what is happening ASAP please.

Sincerely,

Todd McCaffrey

date: Sat, 21 Aug 2021 19:55:57 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Georgeanne Kennedy<squeej51g@gmail.com>
subject: How's it going?

Body:
HI Squeej,

I've been saying to myself for a couple of weeks now, "I should write 
Gigi and ask her how things are going with her."

So... How's it going?

Over here, we're hanging in. We're worried about the delta variant, 
particularly because Brit's doctor has told her specifically NOT to get 
the vaccine -- it might make things much worse for her.

As it is, Brit will be heading back to LA to see an eye doctor at UCLA 
because in the past several weeks she's noticed two very troubling 
things: her hearing has gotten worse and her eyesight has gotten worse.  
A good retinal doctor here in Vegas detected signs of thinning in the 
optic nerve.  Not good.  Brit took the news in stride.  She's hoping 
that it's Usher's Type 3 because then she'll have a diagnosis.  It also 
helps that the eye doctor in UCLA has seen her before, willingly calls 
*her* and is also the guy who originally determined the existence of 
Usher's Type 3. Anyway, we cross fingers.  In the meantime, Brit has got 
hearing aids and loves being able to hear things she didn't notice for 
the past five years -- like being able to hear her nails tapping on things.

I am busy writing a sequel to a novel I just completed.  The first 
novel, RAW SPACE, is out with alpha readers.  You know, nothing out of 
the ordinary, just a space opera where someone has planted zombie sex 
bugs on the Fleet's laundry ship ;)

I hope you're doing well.

Love,

Todd

date: Tue, 12 May 2020 08:52:51 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Janis Ian<janisian@earthlink.net>
subject: Hello from Vegas!

Body:
Hi Janis,

I hope you're doing well but I worry about you being in Florida.

I am now 64 (unbelievable!) but it really doesn't feel all that much 
different from 60.

We've been hunkered down -- we self-isolated pretty early as we're all 
high-risk (asthma, diabetes, age, etc.) so we've been holding up just fine.

Who'd'a thunk that face masks would be all the rage in 2020?  Not that 
their efficaciousness is all that great but every little bit helps.

The COVID-19 thing had me pretty rattled for a while but I'm getting 
over it.  Not so much the dying part but just the whole strangeness of 
it all.
It made me realize how lucky we've been in the 20th century.  We'd 
gotten complacent about our health and longevity.  I imagine that's 
going to change.

Anyway, dealing with that slowed me on writing for a bit (also, not 
being able to write in Starbucks).

Do you read Kindle format or do you want PDF or DOC for reading?  I know 
I offered to send you some reading material, I forgot to ask about the 
format.

I've been playing with a bunch of Native Instruments software and 
hardware (picked up their 32-key keyboard, and their cool Maschine pad) 
as well as making art and writing (the all round creative).

Anyway, that's about all the news that's fit to print.
Cheers,
Todd

date: Wed, 10 Feb 2021 22:56:02 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Brit Winner<bybritwinner@gmail.com>
subject: Fwd: For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman

Body:
Also for YOUR information.

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	For Your Consideration Project Blue Book: The Game by 
Steven-Elliot Altman
Date: 	Thu, 11 Feb 2021 04:31:01 +0500
From: 	Steve Altman <steve@socialimpulse.com>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

Hey Todd,

Steve Altman here. Hope this email finds you well, it's been awhile, and 
I pray we all get to meet up at conventions again. <sigh>

In the meantime, please forgive my shameless promotion here. I'm gunning 
for recommendations for my last History channel videogame, /Project Blue 
Book/ with little or no guidance and have drummed up this post on the 
SFWA board. For amplification purposes I am sending it out to certain 
SFWA members who may be interested in playing and/or reading the game's 
script for consideration. Hope you won't mind being on my list. Did you 
happen to catch the TV series? Well worth watching.

Here is an overview of *Project Blue Book: The Game* with the attached 
game script for your consideration (as well as some smaller samples) and 
links to play the game for free. Enjoy!

The information below has been posted in its entirety on the Members 
Only SFWA message boards at the following link, and should be treated 
confidentially: 
https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/topic/15951-project-blue-book-the-game-by-steven-elliot-altman-and-julie-marsh/>

Project Blue Book The Game Image 2.png

Project Blue Book: The Game by Steven-Elliot Altman and Julie Marsh

Please find attached the Final Production Draft of Project Blue Book: 
The Game, which I wrote for A&E Networks based on their History Channel 
series, along with my clue writer Julie Marsh (Julie was not credited on 
the game itself, as I was featured, but I am compelled to include her 
for consideration due to her essential contributions).

I was attempting to bring the genres of television writing and videogame 
writing one step closer. I was given nearly free reign by the network 
and showrunners on how to proceed, and so decided to write my own 
adaptations of half the game's cases based on produced episodes of the 
TV series (with additional scenes that I envisioned) and the other half 
of the cases as original cases which I based on actual declassified 
U.S.A.F Project Blue Book files.

The Production Draft encompasses all 9 Cases of Season One of the game. 
Because this document is quite lengthy I have also attached "Case 105: 
The Aztec Recovery" (in which I introduce J. Robert Oppenheimer to the 
game's story) and "Case 107: Project Rainbow" (in which I 
introduce Albert Einstein to the game's story, in a story previously 
dramatized as the feature film /The Philadelphia Experiment/) as two 
smaller samples of the complete work.

Besides the script, the game is FREE TO PLAY as a mobile app available 
for both IOS and Android phones and tablets in the safe links listed 
below, and I invite you to play!

Project Blue Book: The Game on IOS 
<https://apps.apple.com/us/app/project-blue-book-the-game/id1445162277>

Project Blue Book: The Game on Android 
<https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.threegates.projectbluebook&hl=en_US>

And for anyone who does not wish to actually play the game, here are 
two youtube videos posted by players that depict the game's opening 
tutorial, and the start of CASE 101, The Fuller Dogfight.

Project Blue Book Opening Cut Scene and Tutorial 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFhBUpUeqsE&t=5s>

Project Blue Book Case 101 Walkthrough 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OOhAgdjG7bY&t=23s>

And finally, here is the approved description from the app store:

Project Blue Book: The Game is the official, free-to-play, hidden object 
adventure game based on HISTORY’s hit drama series PROJECT BLUE BOOK, 
created by David O'Leary, and executive produced by Academy Award and 
Golden Globe® winner Robert Zemeckis. The series explores the 
historical, Top Secret investigations into UFOs conducted by the U.S. 
Air Force between 1952 and 1969.

In Project Blue Book: The Game, you will start off as a newly recruited 
agent in Project Blue Book during the 1950s, under the guidance of the 
show's lead investigators, Dr. J. Allen Hynek (played by Aidan Gillen 
from “Game Of Thrones”), and Captain Michael Quinn (played by Michael 
Malarkey from “The Vampire Diaries”), and begin to investigate real 
declassified UFO investigations to find the truth!

Hundreds of puzzles, witness interviews and hidden object scenes will 
challenge your observation and deduction tactics as you investigate 
alongside your favorite characters into many of the cases you loved from 
the series, uncover exclusive new content, and explore new cases that 
can only be found in the game! The game's story is written by 
bestselling science-fiction writer and award-winning game writer 
Steven-Elliot Altman, best known for similar social games like PEARL’S 
PERIL and ANCIENT ALIENS.

We're here to find the truth! So, come help us investigate flying 
saucers along with Dr. Hynek in the world's first Unidentified Flying 
(Hidden) Object Game!

Thank you for considering *Project Blue Book: The Game* for a Nebula 
Nomination in the best game writing category. Should you wish to 
nominate it, here is the SFWA link: https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/ 
<https://www.sfwa.org/forum/ballots/>

Love and light to you and your family,
Steve

*Steven-Elliot Altman*
Chief Executive Officer

  Phone  +1 (323) 708-9005
  Fax       +1 (877) 581-8750
  Site Socialimpulse.com <http://Socialimpulse.com>

date: Tue, 07 Dec 2021 22:55:11 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Georgeanne Kennedy<squeej51g@gmail.com>
subject: Catching up

Body:
Hi Squeej,

I see from the Irish Times that you're all being inundated.  I hope it's 
not too bad. Curiously enough, it's raining here in Vegas.

We've survived Channukah although I still have more gifts to give (so 
we'll get them out nearly to Xmas).

Dex tells me that he's taking Russian 102 next semester and a bunch of 
other stuff.

I binge watched "I am not okay with this" which, it turns out, Dex had 
recommended but I'd forgotten.

20BooksTo50k Vegas was a lot of fun, the first time I've been out for a bit.

I've slowed down a bit on my Canaris Rift series, had to stop and 
re-read everything and make notes so that I knew where I was in terms of 
equipment and all.

I also binge watched the 3rd season of the new Lost In Space which I 
quite enjoyed.  I've been following Hawkeye on Disney. In addition, I 
discovered "A Boy Called Christmas" which is now among my favorite 
all-time Xmas stories.

I hope you're doing well.

Love,

Todd

date: Tue, 20 Jul 2021 19:57:57 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: David Weber<davidweber@davidweber.net>
subject: Thank you!

Body:
Hi David,

Thank you for getting me a copy of "A Call to Insurrection!"

it was much enjoyed!

One niggle -- at the end of the last book, Calvingdell and Locatelli are 
involved in a coin toss over who gets Travis. I  do wish that had been 
explicitly resolved.

It's nice to see Travis and Gavin communicating.

The situation with Serisburg seemed to beg for a bit more preamble and I 
thought Chomps might have been a lot quicker on the up-take. I think I 
also would have liked to see more personalities involved in the 
ONI/Delphi clash.

Even though I've seen them both before, I got a bit muddled with 
Damocles and Diacritos -- both being D names. I would have loved a bit 
more of "the courier ship, Diacritos" to keep them clear.

I do certainly look forward to more!

Cheers,

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WonderCon 2022 Professional Badge Confirmation - Order Number: 
79873
Date: 	Tue, 22 Mar 2022 01:31:10 +0000 (UTC)
From: 	donotreply@comic-con.org
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

*INDUSTRY - HALL D*

*WonderCon 2022 Badge Confirmation
/April 1-3, 2022
/*

    Badges

Registrant 	Todd J. McCaffrey
Registration Type 	Professional
Badge Number 	791443759

Hello Todd J.,

We’re so excited to have you join us for WonderCon 2022! Please bring 
this confirmation and a valid photo ID on-site to pick up your badge. In 
addition to wearing an approved face covering, you will be required to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status _or_ proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken within 48 hours for a PCR test or within 24 
hours for an antigen test. Click here 
<https://www.comic-con.org/wca/covid-19-faq> for more information.

*REMINDER: You must pick up all badges associated with your order, 
including your guest badge (if any), using this barcode confirmation 
email. Guests will not be allowed to pick up their own badges. There 
will be no on-site "will call" for professional guests.*

This barcode confirmation is good for WonderCon 2022. You may not 
transfer, sell, and/or share your barcode confirmation. The name on your 
barcode confirmation must match your photo ID when you arrive on-site. 
Your order details can be found below.

Please keep this confirmation safe and secure. Do not duplicate or share 
your barcode confirmation with anyone else. If it is scanned on-site 
before you arrive, your barcode will not work, and you will not receive 
a badge.

    WonderCon Badge Pick-Up

Your WonderCon badge will be available for pick-up at the *Industry 
Registration Area* in *Hall D* of the Anaheim Convention Center: 800 W 
Katella Ave, Anaheim, CA, 92802. Please look for the designated *BLUE 
Industry line* when you arrive in Hall D. You will need this 
confirmation and a valid photo ID to pick up your badge.

*WonderCon Badge Pick-Up Hours*
Thursday (3/31)* 	12:00 PM - 7:00 PM
Friday (4/1) 	9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Saturday (4/2) 	8:30 AM - 7:00 PM
Sunday (4/3)
	8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

*Thursday hours are for badge pick-up *only*. There is no programming on 
Thursday, and the Exhibit Hall is closed.

Badge pick-up hours are subject to change. For the most current badge 
pick-up hours, please visit our website 
<https://comic-con.org/wca/professional-faq>.

    Child Badges

Children age 12 and under are free with a registered adult. You may 
register a child for a complimentary badge on-site at the *Registration 
Area*located in *Hall D*of the Anaheim Convention Center. All children 
will be required to follow the COVID-19 policy.

/Children must be present to be registered for a badge and you //will be 
required to provide emergency contact information for any child 
registrant./

    More Information

Please visit www.comic-con.org/wca <http://www.comic-con.org/wca> for 
information on hotel reservations, directions, parking, and public 
transportation. Parking and traffic can be a challenge if you are not 
prepared.

    The Fine Print

*Terms and Conditions*
By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status or proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken on or after Wednesday, March 30. WonderCon 
reserves the right to modify requirements or limits for attending or 
participating in Activities.

By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree not 
to sell, trade, transfer or share your complimentary code, badge 
confirmation, or badge. In the event that San Diego Comic 
Convention/WonderCon/Comic-Con International (SDCC) determines that you 
have violated this policy, SDCC has the right to cancel your entire 
badge order and keep any money paid by you. Confirmations and/or badges 
that have been sold or provided by anyone other than SDCC will not be 
honored by SDCC. You must wear and display your badge at all times while 
onsite and at any official SDCC event.

All badges are the property of SDCC and must be relinquished to SDCC 
upon request. SDCC reserves the right to refuse admission, to refuse 
service, and/or to cancel/revoke your Member ID and/or badge at SDCC's 
discretion.

Subject: Fwd: THE KING'S GHOSTS typos, etc. - Chapter 12 - End

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	THE KING'S GHOSTS typos, etc. - Chapter 12 - End
Date: 	Mon, 15 Nov 2021 20:16:02 -0800 (PST)
From: 	Susan Silver <ssilver61@comcast.net>
To: 	Todd McCaffrey <todd@toddwriter.com>

Hi Todd,

Here are my observations through the end of the book.

I mentioned previously that the plural of SC is used two different 
ways... either SCs or SC's.  In these remaining chapters, it is written 
both ways. I'm sure you've already addressed this even though it doesn't 
show up in the version I downloaded.  Just throwing this out there since 
I did observe it.

*Chapter12*
Location 4956 - typo... her, not his .../Margaret replied cheerfully, 
bounding out of /her /seat./

Location 5107 - awkward sentence, not sure if you meant to say ./..relay 
a stream of conscious report of an SC that *is* thinking very loudly/ or 
possibly /...relay a stream of conscious report of an SC that *thinks* 
very loudly /or /if it's ...conscious report *to* an SC.../

Location 5147 - typo... I, not If  (*I* believe that it will be more 
meaningful...)

Location 5188 - typo... insert "would" (But what *would* you do in my 
position?)

Location 5217 - typo... Clio, not Cio

Location 5243 - not sure that *nearly* fits here unless it is supposed 
to be *just*. Maybe omit it completely? (...looked to Owami for 
confirmation, but Owami nearly waved her back to Cona).

Location 5347 - typo... on, not off (...co-pilot's hands so that they 
were centered *on* the self-destruct button...)

Location 5425 - "Admirals Branford" isn't correct. Janis is not a 
Branford, but he is an Admiral.

*Chapter 13*
Location 5572 - when onboard the ships, the British word lift is used.  
Actually, I think it works fine.  Just pointing out the use of British 
English.

Location 5588 -  May not be anything but... /You've been requested to go 
TDY to the NWC for the next week./ Not quite sure what this means. Is 
TDY Training Duty?  If so, my mind would read it better as /You've been 
requested to *do* TDY *at* the NWC for the next week./  Maybe this is 
how they speak and my non-military mind just has problems.

Location 5739 - Comma needed for If/then sentence: /Because if she were 
picked*,***it'd mean that.../

Location 5817 - typo... planted, not planet (...and by whom that 
bacterial assault was *planted* on Sparkle)

Location 5858 - typo... Rochelle, not Rachel

Location 5935 - Insert "said"... Fromer *said* as he strolled...

*Chapter 14*
Location 5962: typo... The, not They (*The* four of them fit..)

*Chapter 15*
Location 6488: tonnes - is it British for tons? (...there's /tonnes/ 
we're not seeing). I may have seen this somewhere else, but not sure if 
it was in this book or the first one, /Raw Space/.

Location 6724 - is this a typo... she, not he or is there someone else 
Owami is referring to? (She didn't want to joggle the Major's arm while 
*she* was conducing the assault...)

Location 6744 - typo... her, not him (Cona sent in *her* first team...)

Location 6772 - typo... her, not his (/Clip/, Cona ordered and *her* 
reserve squad moved out...)

Location 6824 - typo... outsider should be plural (... the name used 
with *outsiders* for /The King's Own Ghosts...)/

*Chapter 16*
Location 6966 (2nd paragraph of chapter) - This is a very long sentence. 
Suggestions: 1) move the comma from before to after "Scotty" and 2)  
drop the "when" along with the comma and put a period after Munchkin

Location 7032 - typo... on, not own ("So put her *on* alert," Rochelle 
said.)

Location 7088 - same confusing working for me: ...cadets were with us 
TDY to the NWC...  Guess it's just me.

Location 7159 - typo... Morton has a "w" on the end

*Chapter 17*
Location 7227 - typo whether, not when (... hard pressed to say 
*whether* her bedmate was male, female, or something else.)

Location 7244 - The math doesn't work. If Neff's sun is 700,000 times 
larger than Canaris Prime, it would be 14 million km in diameter, not 
1.4 km.  For 1.4 million km diameter, it would only be 70,000 times 
larger. (FYI - I did not check the mass calculations.)

Location 7279 - 1) typo... *Ophelia* is not possessive and 2) delete 
"said even" (...kneeling down to Ophelia's said even as she hit...)

That's all I have for you Todd.  Hope I didn't get this to you too late.
Susan

Cheers,

Todd McCafrey

date: Tue, 28 Apr 2020 19:53:33 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Kenneth Lee<klee10026@gmail.com>
subject: Renewal for 7861 Dell Ridge Ave.

Body:
Mr. Lee

In these trying times we are all facing uncertainty. I would like to 
know if the owners intention is to re-lease the house, sell it or 
otherwise. I texted you last week requesting an update on releasing and 
have not received an answer, which is somewhat disconcerting. It is a 
very simple question which should not require much deliberation.

If the owners intention is to sell the home I am interested in 
discussing that option as well. Given the virus and all the 
ramifications I really need to know what is happening ASAP please.

Sincerely,

Todd McCaffrey

date: Sun, 10 Jan 2021 10:40:45 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Brianna Winner<briannarosewinner@gmail.com>
subject: Trump's speech

Body:
From "The Plam Beach Post" 
<https://www.palmbeachpost.com/story/news/politics/2021/01/06/what-trump-said-rally-speech-spark-u-s-capitol-storming/6568337002/>

And what did Trump say 
<https://www.palmbeachpost.com/videos/news/nation/2021/01/06/trump-if-pence-does-right-thing-we-win/6566072002/>? 
Here is the passage from his speech that directed his followers to head 
to Capitol Hill.

"And after this, we're going to walk down there, and I'll be there with 
you, we're going to walk down ... to the Capitol and we are going to 
cheer on our brave senators and congressmen and women," Trump told the 
crowd. "And we're probably not going to be cheering so much for some of 
them. Because you'll never take back our country with weakness. You have 
to show strength and you have to be strong."

Full speech is here. 
<https://www.rev.com/blog/transcripts/donald-trump-speech-save-america-rally-transcript-january-6>

The video is here. <https://youtu.be/iGX4jO3rG8g>

More from the relevant section:

Donald Trump: (16:25 
<https://www.rev.com/transcript-editor/shared/7Nw_aFgSCwkywakGftVXzVw6NTJEvtBTeS6rNigOo221hgTCjvDEnf_zvai7Hv5hmGYuImOca6TjcP2GuV0K1i_9pOY?loadFrom=PastedDeeplink&ts=985.66>)
Our media is not free. It’s not fair. It suppresses thought. It 
suppresses speech, and it’s become the enemy of the people. It’s become 
the enemy of the people. It’s the biggest problem we have in this 
country. No third world countries would even attempt to do what we 
caught them doing and you’ll hear about that in just a few minutes. 
Republicans are constantly fighting like a boxer with his hands tied 
behind his back. It’s like a boxer, and we want to be so nice. We want 
to be so respectful of everybody, including bad people. We’re going to 
have to fight much harder and Mike Pence is going to have to come 
through for us. If he doesn’t, that will be a sad day for our country 
because you’re sworn to uphold our constitution. Now it is up to 
Congress to confront this egregious assault on our democracy. After 
this, we’re going to walk down and I’ll be there with you. We’re going 
to walk down. We’re going to walk down any one you want, but I think 
right here. We’re going walk down to the Capitol, and we’re going to 
cheer on our brave senators, and congressmen and women. We’re probably 
not going to be cheering so much for some of them because you’ll never 
take back our country with weakness. You have to show strength, and you 
have to be strong.

Donald Trump: (18:16 
<https://www.rev.com/transcript-editor/shared/7Nw_aFgSCwkywakGftVXzVw6NTJEvtBTeS6rNigOo221hgTCjvDEnf_zvai7Hv5hmGYuImOca6TjcP2GuV0K1i_9pOY?loadFrom=PastedDeeplink&ts=1096.35>)
We have come to demand that Congress do the right thing and only count 
the electors who have been lawfully slated, lawfully slated. I know that 
everyone here will soon be marching over to the Capitol building to 
peacefully and patriotically make your voices heard. Today we will see 
whether Republicans stand strong for integrity of our elections, but 
whether or not they stand strong for our country, our country. Our 
country has been under siege for a long time, far longer than this 
four-year period. We’ve set it on a much straighter course, a much … I 
thought four more years. I thought it would be easy. We created-

Message Details:
First Name: Bob
Last Name: Weber
Email: bweber66@gmail.com <mailto:bweber66@gmail.com>
Phone: 6194819717
Message: Dear Brittany and Brianna, I realize that you most likely won't 
remember me, but that's okay. We first met at a WotF workshop in 
Hollywood in 2015 (I think). At the time I was teaching high school 
physics and English (SF/Fantasy Literature) at an all boys Catholic 
school in San Diego. I was mesmerized by the story of your development 
from "reluctant readers" to bestselling authors. Very inspirational for 
a teacher! At Comic-Con in 2017, I attended your panel and visited your 
booth on the Exhibit Hall Floor, where you graciously gifted me with 
your World Building guide (although that may have come from the 
workshop; I don't really remember) and an autographed copy of "The 
Strand Prophecy." For reasons I won't go into here, I will tell you that 
the book sat on my shelf for almost a year before I finally read it, and 
that the 2017 Comic-Con was the last one I attended--until this year. I 
was so happy to have gotten tickets for this year's Con, and so 
disappointed when it was cancelled. But here we are at Comic-Con at 
Home, and I am able finally to tell you both that I finally did read 
"The Strand Prophecy," and I really enjoyed it! My life circumstances 
have changed rather significantly since last we met, and I see that 
yours have as well. Brittany, I was shocked and sorry to hear about your 
vision loss, but I'm happy to hear you're still going strong. I now no 
longer teach high school physics and English to boys, but middle school 
science and literature to both boys and girls at a Catholic K-12 school 
in Indiana. VERY different climate from SoCal, and not just in terms of 
the weather! I was looking through your products offered on the 
Comic-Con at Home Exhibitor Hall website, and I had a couple of 
questions that I hope you can answer before I start purchasing (and 
thank you in advance for your time): 1. How many total volumes are there 
in the Twin Soul series, and how many of these are compiled in the 
Omnibus? Is this a series that would be appropriate for middle school 
students from conservative Catholic families? 2. Is Millennial Madness 
an autobiography, or is it a fictionalized story? I'd love to be able to 
share your ladies' story with my own students, IN YOUR WORDS. It's nice 
to be in touch with you again. I love your work! Looking forward to 
hearing back from you soon--hopefully before the Con ends and before you 
run out of merchandise! :) Be well! May God bless you both! Sincerely, 
Bob Weber P.S. I look forward to your email response, but feel free to 
call if you wish. I always have really enjoyed our conversations.
Phone 2: 6194819717

date: Wed, 17 Feb 2021 09:00:51 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Pamela Melroy<pamela.a.melroy@gmail.com>
subject: Oh my goodness!

Body:
Pam,

I hope this is still a good email address.

In looking back, I realize that it's been THREE YEARS since I last spoke 
to you!  I think perhaps I took the whole "Pam's busy, don't bother her" 
thinking a bit too far.

I hope you're doing well.

I'm in Las Vegas these days and hanging in there.

Recently I've come to the notion that we're going to need rotating 
centripetal-gravity producing stations to survive in space (of course, 
whether the moon's gravity would be sufficient remains to be explored.)  
This brought me back to the whole Gerard K O'Neill's Space Settlements 
publication (it was a NASA SP at one point).

I noticed that DARPA has just recently announced NOM4D which sounds like 
a good start on space manufacturing (it seems like something that might 
have your fingerprints on it).

I'm in the process of writing the President to suggest that we need a 
new great challenge for our nation and believe that the time is ripe to 
push fully into space... and staying there.

I was wondering if you had any thoughts on that or pointers to thoughts.

I'm also trying to build a near term science fiction story line based on 
this (sorta Space Cadet but for the 21st century).  I had an "aliens 
invade" dystopian idea set on the asteroid belt (called "Minor's War" 
because it's a YA about asteroid miners taking back Earth) but my heart 
is never really in dystopian/apocalyptic stories.

A proper rotating space station would also be a great place to learn how 
to properly create self-sustaining environmental systems.  Also, we 
really need to start to learn how to build stuff in space instead of 
simply boosting it pre-built from Earth.

Anyway, I hope you're well, challenged, and happy!

Cheers,

Todd McCaffrey

date: Wed, 05 Oct 2022 18:09:14 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Monique Bucheger<monique.bucheger@gmail.com>
subject: Re: Trouble Blows West

Body:
Hi Monique,

Thank you for your patience, I read Trouble Blows West.

It did not work for me.  Permit me to emphasize, it did not work for *me.*
*
*
Here's why the book didn't work for me:

Ginny's character just didn't seem real to me.  It became less so as the 
book progressed. Her mounting anger and vengeance didn't have any 
rational background to support them and her unwillingness to listen to 
reason or learn finally killed any sympathy I might have had for her.

I also questioned the setting -- was this in the 1970s? 80s? 90s? 
Earlier? Later?

Ginny's love for her mare didn't work for me. I grew up with horse mad 
girls, and Ginny didn't fit.  It seemed to me that her horse was at 
about the same level in her affections as a rusted hand-me-down bicycle.

I began to notice the number of chapters.  There's an *awful* lot of them.

I also wasn't sure about the farm -- was it a cattle farm? Dairy? Crop? 
Mixed use?  That question nagged at me and helped pull me out of the book.

Cheers,
Todd McCaffrey

P.S.: The YA/Middle Grade books that I read include:

Ally Carter's /The Gallagher Girls/ 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000S1LF5K>
also Ally Carter's Winterborne Home for Vengeance and Valor 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07T4HQR9D>
Alan Bradley started a marvelous series about an eleven year-old sleuth 
with The Sweetness at the Bottom of the Pie 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0027G6XDS>
L.A. Meyer produced the amazing Bloody Jack 
<https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003K16PPU> series.
Also, Carlos Hernandez knocked it out of the park with Sal and Gabi 
Break the Universe <https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FL82MKG> which is 
currently an Amazon #1 Best Seller

	"Craft Day" provides the opportunity for you to spend one day (the day 
prior to the main seminar) focusing on the craft of writing in intensive 
sessions led by industry professionals and bestselling authors. You'll 
choose one three-hour session for the morning, and another for the 
afternoon. We will notify you when it is time to choose the options. 
Workshops to be determined.
Craft Day AM (choose 1 AM session if you purchase Craft Day) 	AM: 
Jonathan Maberry, Bestselling Pacing 	
	Novels can be short or long –and in some genres very long—but they 
should all move along at a brisk yet compelling pace. NY Times 
bestseller Jonathan Maberry, author of over forty novels in multiple 
genres, is your tour guide for a journey through the art and science of 
PACING. Topics covered include Creating the Right Novel Structure, 
Timing, Red Herrings, Foreshadowing, Plot Complexity, Overlapping 
Storylines, The Importance of Supporting Characters, Pacing in Single 
Character POV and Ensemble, Shifting POV, Parsing Info Instead of 
Dumping, Varying Forms of Dialogue, Building a Story Chronology and more!
Craft Day PM (choose onePM session if you purchase Craft Day) 	PM: Hugh 
Howey, Full Sensory Writing 	
	In this workshop you will learn that there are more than five primary 
senses, and you will master techniques to tap into them all. You will 
also learn how to place yourself inside your scenes and craft the little 
details that convince your readers that what you are describing is real, 
not fiction. After this session, you will be well on your way to writing 
action scenes that feel cinematic, dialog that is authentic, and 
characters who leap off the page with extra dimension.

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WonderCon 2022 Professional Badge Confirmation
Date: 	Wed, 30 Mar 2022 08:49:09 +0000
From: 	WonderCon <donotreply@comic-con.org>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

*INDUSTRY - HALL D*

*WonderCon 2022 Badge Confirmation
/April 1-3, 2022
/*

    Badges

Registrant 	Todd J. McCaffrey
Registration Type 	Professional
Badge Number 	791443759

Hello Todd J.,

We’re so excited to have you join us for WonderCon 2022! Please bring 
this confirmation and a valid photo ID on-site to pick up your badge. In 
addition to wearing an approved face covering, you will be required to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status _or_ proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours. There will be 
*verification stations outside the perimeter of the Anaheim Convention 
Center,*including the Transit Plaza to the south of the center, the 
Arena Plaza from Katella, and at the east end of the ACC promenade 
between the Hilton and Marriott hotels. *Click here* 
<http://comic-con.configio.com/ct/68/243988037> for more information.

*REMINDER: You must pick up all badges associated with your order, 
including your guest badge (if any), using this barcode confirmation 
email. Guests will not be allowed to pick up their own badges. There 
will be no on-site "will call" for professional guests.*

This barcode confirmation is good for WonderCon 2022. You may not 
transfer, sell, and/or share your barcode confirmation. The name on your 
barcode confirmation must match your photo ID when you arrive on-site. 
Your order details can be found below.

Please keep this confirmation safe and secure. Do not duplicate or share 
your barcode confirmation with anyone else. If it is scanned on-site 
before you arrive, your barcode will not work, and you will not receive 
a badge.

    WonderCon 2022 Badge Pick-Up

Your WonderCon professional badge will be available for pick-up at the 
*Industry Registration Area* in *Hall D* of the Anaheim Convention 
Center: 800 W Katella Ave, Anaheim, CA, 92802. Please look for the 
designated *BLUE Industry line* when you arrive in Hall D. You will need 
this confirmation and a valid photo ID to pick up your badge.

*WonderCon Badge Pick-Up Hours*
Thursday (3/31)* 	12:00 PM - 7:00 PM
Friday (4/1) 	9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Saturday (4/2) 	8:30 AM - 7:00 PM
Sunday (4/3)
	8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

*Thursday hours are for badge pick-up *only*. There is no programming on 
Thursday, and the Exhibit Hall is closed.

Badge pick-up hours are subject to change. For the most current badge 
pick-up hours, please visit our website 
<http://comic-con.configio.com/ct/70/243988037>.

    Child Badges

Children age 12 and under are free with a registered adult. You may 
register a child for a complimentary badge on-site at the *Registration 
Area*located in *Hall D*of the Anaheim Convention Center. All children 
will be required to follow the COVID-19 policy.

/Children must be present to be registered for a badge and you //will be 
required to provide emergency contact information for any child 
registrant./

    More Information

Please visit www.comic-con.org/wca 
<http://comic-con.configio.com/ct/71/243988037> for information on hotel 
reservations, directions, parking, and public transportation. Parking 
and traffic can be a challenge if you are not prepared.

    The Fine Print

*Terms and Conditions*
By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree to 
provide verification of full COVID-19 vaccination status or proof of a 
negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours. WonderCon reserves the 
right to modify requirements or limits for attending or participating in 
Activities.

By registering for a paid or complimentary WonderCon badge you agree not 
to sell, trade, transfer or share your complimentary code, badge 
confirmation, or badge. In the event that San Diego Comic 
Convention/WonderCon/Comic-Con International (SDCC) determines that you 
have violated this policy, SDCC has the right to cancel your entire 
badge order and keep any money paid by you. Confirmations and/or badges 
that have been sold or provided by anyone other than SDCC will not be 
honored by SDCC. You must wear and display your badge at all times while 
on-site and at any official SDCC event.

All badges are the property of SDCC and must be relinquished to SDCC 
upon request. SDCC reserves the right to refuse admission, to refuse 
service, and/or to cancel/revoke your Member ID and/or badge at SDCC's 
discretion.

We encourage you to review the full WonderCon badge purchase Terms & 
Conditions at https://www.comic-con.org/wca/terms-and-conditions 
<http://comic-con.configio.com/ct/72/243988037>

Comic-Con International

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Attn.: Sherri Rabinowitz - Radio Show Guest Todd McCaffrey 
CONFIRMED! [ Chatting with Sherri - RESCHEDULED ]
Date: 	Mon, 25 Jan 2021 19:33:26 -0800
From: 	Carmen Bartolo <mediarelationscarmen@gmail.com>
To: 	rithebard@yahoo.com
CC: 	todd@toddwriter.com, John Goodwin <jgoodwin@galaxypress.com>, E 
Jones <ej2@authorservicesinc.com>

Hi Sherri! [RESCHEDULED]

I have author and Writers of the Future judge, Todd 
McCaffrey, confirmed for a pre-recorded phone interview on your show, 
"Chatting with Sherri," on Wednesday, January 27th at 1:00 PM Pacific 
for about 30 - 45 minutes.

*This will be a Skype call,...*

*Todd's Skype username: **live:todd427_1*

*Sherri's Skype username: rithebard*

As backup, I have Todd's cell number as 818.324.5127 and I have your 
cell phone number as 619.654.2150.

As Galaxy Press is the publisher for the anthology, /*L. Ron Hubbard 
Presents Writers of the Future */I trust there will be some opportunity 
to *mention the full title of the book *as well as the website, 
www.WritersOfTheFuture.com <http://www.writersofthefuture.com/>.

Talking Points,...

1) Todd's judging of the stories for *L. Ron Hubbard Presents Writers of 
the Future Volume 36 and Volume 37*.

2) Tood's career and what he's currently working on.

3) Mention the website (www.WritersOfTheFuture.com 
<http://www.writersofthefuture.com/>) to give other writers and 
illustrators the opportunity to enter the contest (contest rules are on 
the site) and purchase the book.

4) Promote Todd's own site: *pernhome.com/tjm/ 
<http://pernhome.com/tjm/> **and www.WritersOfTheFuture.com 
<http://www.writersofthefuture.com/>*

*(See bio below.)*

*
*

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me directly, 
323.574.5916 <tel:323.574.5916>.

Thanks,

Carmen

Mr. Carmen Bartolo

Media Relations

Galaxy Press

323.574.5916 <tel:323.574.5916>

MediaRelationsCarmen@gmail.com <mailto:MediaRelationsCarmen@gmail.com>

www.GalaxyPress.com <http://www.galaxypress.com/>

www.WritersOfTheFuture.com <http://www.writersofthefuture.com/>

<<<<<<

  TODD MCCAFFREY

Writer Judge – Biography

Todd McCaffrey was born to Anne McCaffrey on April 27th, 1956. The 
then-named Todd Johnson came into the world as a rather precocious 
middle child. Anyone who questions the precocious part has only to read 
some of the anecdotes in “Dragonholder” to have any doubt removed. He 
spent most of his childhood on the East Coast of the USA until moving to 
Dublin, Ireland with his mother and sister in 1970.

Like most of the boys growing up in the ’60s, McCaffrey became space 
mad. However, unlike most of the other young men running around their 
yards in pretend helmets and throwing toy rockets into the air, he was 
given a “complete” set of the actual Lunar Module Pilot Study Guides in 
1968. The number of hours spent devouring them repeatedly from cover to 
cover is evident in the fact that he has been known to quote excerpts 
from them during convention panels.

When the time came for him to pursue higher education, McCaffrey 
attended Lehigh University in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, for a year—and 
hated it. But he did discover one of the great loves of his life while 
he was there, computers. He graduated with Honors—or rather, 
“Honours”—in 1985 from Trinity College, Dublin.

Having never lost his love for space, he left Ireland for Los Angeles, 
California, in the hopes of working in the aerospace industry. However, 
the computers got him first, and he began working in computer 
programming in 1986. He continued to develop his love of space and all 
mechanical things that fly by getting a private pilot’s license in 1988. 
One interesting side note is the collapse of the aerospace industry in 1989.

During this time, his interest in writing also took flight. The sale of 
some of his early short stories helped him log an impressive amount of 
airtime. He flew across the continent solo in 1989, attending Oshkosh 
along the way. After quitting his day job in 1990 to write full time, he 
repeated his solo cross-continent flight and attended the 1990 Oshkosh 
as well.

Todd McCaffrey became a Writers of the Future judge in 2011.

    /“///The Writers of the Future is one of the premier awards that’s
    available particularly to new writers. It’s basically the only one
    there. This is a chance to open up the universe to reward people who
    are trying and striving and succeeding in creating great stories, to
    reward them with more than just a pat on the back to actually some
    monetary reward and some recognition and to give them a leg up into
    the world of a professional writer.///” /—Todd McCaffrey

Find out more at: pernhome.com/tjm/ <http://pernhome.com/tjm/>

	"Craft Day" provides the opportunity for you to spend one day (the day

choose one three-hour session for the morning, and another for the 
afternoon. We will notify you when it is time to choose the options. 
Workshops to be determined.
Craft Day AM (choose 1 AM session if you purchase Craft Day) 	AM: 
Jonathan Maberry, Bestselling Pacing 	
	Novels can be short or long –and in some genres very long—but they 
should all move along at a brisk yet compelling pace. NY Times 
bestseller Jonathan Maberry, author of over forty novels in multiple 
genres, is your tour guide for a journey through the art and science of 
PACING. Topics covered include Creating the Right Novel Structure, 
Timing, Red Herrings, Foreshadowing, Plot Complexity, Overlapping 
Storylines, The Importance of Supporting Characters, Pacing in Single 
Character POV and Ensemble, Shifting POV, Parsing Info Instead of 
Dumping, Varying Forms of Dialogue, Building a Story Chronology and more!
Craft Day PM (choose onePM session if you purchase Craft Day) 	PM: Hugh 
Howey, Full Sensory Writing 	
	In this workshop you will learn that there are more than five primary 
senses, and you will master techniques to tap into them all. You will 
also learn how to place yourself inside your scenes and craft the little 
details that convince your readers that what you are describing is real, 
not fiction. After this session, you will be well on your way to writing 
action scenes that feel cinematic, dialog that is authentic, and 
characters who leap off the page with extra dimension.

date: Thu, 03 Dec 2020 08:47:22 -0800
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: <dean.wmgworkshops@gmail.com>
subject: Crime Assign #1

Body:
**

*Is the movie Die Hard(the first one) a Holiday Crime story or not?*

*

Well… damn.

Die Hard(1988) is one of my favorite movies. The dialog, the pacing… 
everything in that movie just works. They not only handle the hero well, 
they handle the supporting characters well.

It used to be that you could go to Drew’s Script-o-rama 
<http://www.script-o-rama.com/>and read the screenplay (probably final 
cut). And that screenplay reads. Just reading it to yourself, on your 
own, and you get the pacing, the pull, the feel of the story. Good stuff.

So when the question comes, is it a holiday crime story, the answer 
seems obvious. It’s certainly a crime story -- bad guys want to steal 
hundreds of millions of bearer bonds and don’t care who (or how many) 
they kill to get them. And it does occur sometime in the Christmas 
holiday frame, probably one to two weeks beforehand (that’s the normal 
time for corporate office parties).

BUT… the test of a holiday story is whether you can take the story out 
of the holiday period and have it still work.

With that in mind, I considered other films that would be regarded as 
holiday films and how they worked.

Consider The Santa Clause (not a crime story), Elf(also not a crime 
story), and Home Alone(a crime story).

In the case of The Santa Clausethe whole premise is that our hero finds 
himself becomingSanta Claus. He transforms from a curmudgeon along the 
way into a person of character and soul. Can you move this story out of 
the Xmas holiday? Nope, no way. The story doesn’t exist without 
Christmas, specifically without the whole Santa Claus mythos. Elfis 
similarly constrained: no story without Christmas (and, in fact, our Elf 
saves Christmas).

With Home Alone, the question becomes more involved. Our young hero is 
accidentally left behind and finds himself defending his home against 
would-be robbers. The basic plot -- young hero left alone to fight 
against bad guys -- is not dependent on the holidays per se.  We could 
have placed this in the summer or spring break or a number of other 
holidays -- or even just played it out withouta holiday (albeit with 
perhaps more difficulty). But the robbers rely on automatic light 
systems and lots of empty houses to target. That spells holidays, and 
pretty much spells Xmas. Also, our hero has a bonding moment with Scary 
Shovel Guy which helps affirm his course of action and speaks to general 
human kindness. So… this would be difficult to make work without the 
Xmas holiday. In this regard, I’d consider this to be a Holiday (Xmas) 
Crime story.

When pondering Die Hardand the question of whether it is a Holiday Crime 
story, I asked myself firstly: Could I change the holiday? If I could, 
then perhaps the “Holiday” part of the “holiday crime” story was 
superfluous.

What if this was a New Year’s Eve story?  Consider inter-cutting between 
the New Year’s Ball falling in Times Square and Hans Gruber falling to 
his death.  Consider, instead of “Now I’ve got a machine gun! Ho-ho-ho!” 
having “Thanks for the party favor, now I can really make noise when the 
ball drops!”  And more.  I’d say that Die Hardcould easily be moved to 
be a New Year story.  In fact, that adds even more to the fundamental 
plot line -- because New Year’s marks new beginnings and the central 
personal question of the movie is “Will John McClane lose his wife and 
family?”  That could now morph into the side question, “What will the 
New Year hold for John McClane?”

[Also, let’s not forget that we’re talking about a Hollywood movie.  
They have to be pretty flexible in their details because no one can be 
certain when someone demands a change of location or timing.]

With this, then, the question becomes: Does this movie haveto be a 
holiday movie (let alone a Christmas movie).  Why can’t it be set in the 
summer?  The essentials -- a new building, corporate party (“great 
quarter”) do not demand a holiday, that could happen any time. The 
robbery could happen any time. In fact, the holidays are possibly a 
badtime for a heist (note, for example, that noneof the Ocean’s movies 
used a holiday), in that such times often come with increased delays and 
heightened security.

So, if we take the holiday out of this movie, does it fall apart? No. 
The fundamental story is not dependent on the time of year, season, or 
holidays. Therefore, this is NOT a HolidayCrime Story.

Hence my, “Well… damn.”

*

Attached please find "Professional Amateurs".  It's a little shorter 
than you wanted, at 3754 words.  Let me know if that's a problem.

I hope you like it!

Cheers,

Todd

Body:
Hi Kevin,

It was great chatting with you at 20Books.

After our talk, I was inspired to go looking again for the book, 
Freefall. I got a copy and re-read it.  I still can't figure out why it 
has't been released as an eBook (sigh).

I think you might enjoy it. Would you like a copy?

Cheers,

Todd

Body:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	WELCOME TO 101 SELF PUBLISHING
Date: 	Fri, 26 Mar 2021 17:09:28 -0400 (EDT)
From: 	Mark Dawson <mark@selfpublishingformula.com>
To: 	todd@toddwriter.com

Your Welcome Message from Mark Dawson
image

*Hello!*

A huge welcome to Self Publishing 101.

Self publishing can be complicated and confusing and I want this course 
to be your easy-to-follow and comprehensive guide to what you need to 
have in place in order to thrive as an independent author.

This email contains important information - please save it for future 
reference.

The course materials can be accessed at this address:

https://selfpublishingformula.com/mycourses 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/4698703130132480/4946397635936256>

Please bookmark this link.

Once at the course directory, it's a good idea to visit 'START HERE' for 
a course orientation video. Once you’re done, dive straight into 101 by 
clicking on the 101 icon.

If that doesn't work, please check that you are logged in. You will see 
a 'Sign in' tab in the top right of the screen if you’re /not/ logged in.

You are entitled to join our ‘Genius' Facebook Group which is exclusive 
to paid students of this course. It is a valuable part of your enrolment 
and it should be your first port of call for any questions you have.

You can apply to join by clicking here 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5255644826959872/4946397635936256>. 
You'll be asked a question when you join, this helps our mods verify you 
are an enrolled student of 101. Here is the question and the response 
you should use:

Q. What is the name of James's new golden retriever puppy?

*A. Enzo*

You are also now a member of the Self Publishing Formula University 
(SPFU). This will include regular live webinars with instructional areas 
on the latest areas of interest for writers. Recordings of the webinars 
are available in the course directory area.

If you have any technical issues or problems with the course, you can 
try posting in Genius for answers or alternatively contact us direct via 
our support email:

support@selfpublishingformula.com <mailto:support@selfpublishingformula.com>

You are entitled to a great set of VIP Bonuses. Most will be issued via 
email (and posted in the course curriculum) around 17th May 2021. 
However, a few are available right away.

BOOKFUNNEL has fast become an essential tool for authors and we know you 
might want to get started right away. We are making the discount code 
available now. Click the following link for your exclusive offer, $50 
off your first year + a free month.

/https://bookfunnel.com/2021spring-sp101/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/6470910051221504/4946397635936256>/

The offer expires on June 30th 2021.

You will also find a course exclusive bonus to PublisherRocket (covered 
in module 2, session 5), here: 
https://rocket.thrivecart.com/publisher-rocket-special/ 
<https://mo349.infusion-links.com/api/v1/click/5181103991816192/4946397635936256>

That's it for now. I'll be in the Genius group as much as I can, so 
please pop in and say hello!

It's great to have you onboard.

*Best wishes,*

*Mark.*

Profile Image 	*Mark Dawson*
Chief Scribbler
Self Publishing Formula Ltd
mark@selfpublishingformula.com
www.selfpublishingformula.com <http://www.selfpublishingformula.com>

Unsubscribe 
<https://mo349.infusionsoft.com/app/linkClick/77414/a3254b91eb5989c0/76336236/022159ef6266e532>

Self Publishing Formula Ltd Windover House St. Ann Street Salisbury, 
Wiltshire SP1 2DR United Kingdom

date: Sun, 30 Aug 2020 00:27:36 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Amelia Johnson<amelia.mj@live.com>
subject: Memories of your Dad and stuff

Body:
*

Hi Amelia,

Here's a quick partial brain dump to give you some more info about who 
your Dad is. Feel free to share with Eliza. I'll write more as I get the 
time. (I'm still REALLY sad about Chadwick Boseman - his is a great loss.)

We grew up in several locations in the US, all in the northeast:

 1.

    Montclair, NJ.  I left when I was two and have no memories.

 2.

    100 Danforth Place, Windybush, Wilmington, Delaware

     1.

        With one interruption, we lived there from the time I was 2
        (1958) until we moved to 369 Carpenter Ave., Sea Cliff, Long
        Island, NY in 1965

 3.

    369 Carpenter Avenue, Sea Cliff, Long Island, New York

     1.

        We lived there from 1965 until we (Gigi, Mum, and I) moved to
        Ireland in 1970

 4.

    In Ireland (just to continue the record), we first lived in:

     1.

          14 North Avenue, Mount Merrion (1970-71)

     2.

        Meadowbrook House, Dundrum (1971-72)

         1.

            Alec joined us there and became a trawler fisherman.

     3.

        Site 11 Rochestown Avenue (1972-73)

         1.

            Alec wasn’t here

     4.

        79 Shanganagh Vale, Cabinteely (1973-1979?)

         1.

            Nor was Alec here.

     5.

        Dragonhold, Kilquade, Co. Wicklow (1979-1987)

         1.

            He visited here occasionally

     6.

         From there, Mum moved into Dragonhold-Underhill and lived there
        until she died in 2011.

I have many memories of Alec, some of which are great and some of which 
are not.

When we were in 100 Danforth, we all got kittens: Tasso (Alec), Tallabar 
(me), and Silkie Blackington (for Gigi with much adult supervision in 
the naming else the cat would have been simply “Blackie”).

Tasso was a tortoise shell.  He lost an argument with a car not long 
after we got him. Alec was devastated.

Tallabar was a multi-color, a mix of grays and oranges.  Quite the 
pretty cat.

Silkie was your average black cat.  She was sweet and her fur was very 
soft, hence the name.

Silkie and Tallabar went on to have many, many litters.  Tallabar was 
good at producing orange marmalade cats.

We also had dogs, starting with Wizard (a German Shepherd) followed by 
his son, Merlin.  Wiz decided that I was his human charge. We had a 
sloping hill outside our front door and it went down to join the street 
which formed part of the branches of a tee-junction (the other street 
tee’d into Danforth Place).  Wiz decided that I was not allowed to go 
down that hill when I was an infant and took to blocking me.

Our next door neighbors (to our left as you’re standing in the front 
door looking out) were the Estes.  Larry Estes was Alec’s age.  I think 
their daughter was close to Gigi’s age.  Alec and Larry hung out and I 
did my best to tag along, often successfully.

There was another housing estate being built across the railroad tracks 
beyond a small woods at the edge of Windybush and we used to trek there 
many a  time. The woods had some pretty decent undergrowth. One day 
Larry got a hold of his father’s machete (from WWII) and he and Alec 
took turns “clearing” the underbrush (think Indiana Jones in South 
America at the beginning of Raiders of the Lost Ark).  I must have been 
around six.  At one point Alec told me to stand back.  I did but, 
apparently, not far enough and the machete tore into my shin.  I think 
it was Alec who carried me back to the house. I went to the ER and got 
four stitches.

Another  time, when I was eight or so, we had a particularly hard but 
dry winter.  It was decided to go exploring (“mountain climbing”?) in 
the culverts at the upper side of the estate.  Alec had brought a hammer 
along to poke holes in the ice as handholds.  He told me (seems to be a 
pattern here) to get back and swung immediately after I said, “Okay” but 
before I could comply (well, that’s my story) and I got the claws of the 
hammer hitting my head -- just on the eye socket.  A bit lower and I 
would have lost the eye.  As it was, I got two stitches without novocaine.

Ah, the good years!

Alec and I fought often enough that I have many recollections of 
variously being forced to eat grass or dirt to escape being buried under 
him.

In 1962 we moved to Dusseldorf, Germany for six months because Dad had a 
job doing PR work for DuPont that required him to work there.  Overall, 
it was a marvelous experience.  Alec, Gigi, and I were all very 
nordic-looking and, when we didn’t speak, had no trouble passing for 
German (Dad’s family had roots in Schleswig-Holstein on the 
German-Danish border).  Mum place Alec and I in the local German 
school.  I can’t say how well Alec did but I flourished, having a 
teacher who could speak English (she was raised in England during the 
war) and I learned excellent “gekauft Deutsch” -- as Mum called it 
(“shopping German”).

We all adored the chocolate over there.  We took the tram everywhere, 
un-parented.  I recall once having some old Frau look at us and scoff, 
“Ach, Englander!” to which I replied, “Nein, Amerikaner!” -- that seemed 
to both affront and appease her, somewhat (the English had ruled the 
area after the war and weren’t particularly good at it).

They had these marvelous parades where they’d throw candy.  We all loved 
that.

We got a VW station wagon while we were over there and, when our time 
was up, drove around Europe (France, Germany, Holland, at least).  We 
took the ferry to England.  We were broke, so we camped one night all in 
the VW and discovered later the next day that we’d stopped outside an 
insane asylum.  We dropped the car off for transport to the States and 
headed to Gatwick airport (Heathrow was not then built), only to 
discover that there was some tax that we still had to pay before we 
could board the flight back.  This caused the parents immense distress 
until a nice American couple, hearing the panic, loaned us the money 
(there were Texans).

*

date: Mon, 17 Aug 2020 17:20:24 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Jay A. Katz<Jkatz@mdmc-law.com>
subject: Alec

Body:
Dear Jay,

I had a long chat with Amelia last night.

I am /so sorry/ that you are having to deal with constant calls from 
Alec. I know that's got to be hard and I'm afraid I can't see any way to 
make things easier for anyone but I did want to say thank you for all 
your efforts, your kindness, and your generosity in dealing with this.  
You are acting above and beyond the call of duty and I wanted you to 
know that I recognize it and am grateful.

Cheers,

Todd

subject: The Magpie's War

Body:
Hi Lois,

Still working on Millisor Rau novel (88+k) but The Winner Twins 
(Brittany and Brianna) and I have just released our epic 
fantasy/historical fiction, /The Mapgie's War./ And we'd like to send 
you a copy.

Interested?'

I can send it either as a Kindle ebook or paperback.  If paperback, I'll 
need an address. If Kindle, I should be set with your email address.

Cheers,

Todd

Dear Jay,

No you most certainly HAVEN'T taken up too much of my time.  I found it 
edifying and very much so!

This helped a lot.  And thank you for being willing to answer questions 
in the future.  I guess now my big job is to find that good attorney you 
were talking about.

Your lips to God's ears!

Cheers,

Todd

subject: Fwd: Your paperback book is available in the Amazon store!

Body:
Finally!

-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	Your paperback book is available in the Amazon store!
Date: 	Thu, 21 May 2020 09:00:17 +0000
From: 	Kindle Direct Publishing <kdp-no-reply@amazon.com>
To: 	us@oddballauthors.com

Congratulations, your paperback, "Extinctions Embrace," is available to 
buy on Amazon 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/r.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=HUHHVBCT71GB&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2F0979054818%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860&H=O8VII8KFVS1CZALOKTO6AMODEXMA&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860>. 
If you republished your book, your changes are now live.

*What's next*

  * *Linking.* The detail pages of your paperback and eBook should link
    within 48 hours, but it can take up to 5 days. See requirements for
    linking.
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=1PSG4G3EBOAPN&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%2Ftopic%2FG200652220%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860&H=UEO8A9HY7HBXFTXRBHHIWFS6AO4A&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860>
  * *Product description.* It can take 24-48 hours to appear on the
    detail page.
  * *Look Inside the Book.* This feature will be available in 7 business
    days.
  * *International marketplaces.* It takes 3-5 business days for your
    paperback to show as in stock.
  * *Updates.* Changes to contributor, series name, series number, page
    count, description, keywords, and browse categories take up to 72
    hours to appear.

Learn more about publishing timelines 
<https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=1LSJW2QQ5A97I&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%2Ftopic%2FG202173620%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860&H=7MAIWLXMCHEMWNI5WOZULVSOVJ8A&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860>.

*Publishing resources*

  * *Order copies.* You can order author copies
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=1CMXIQXYACPPU&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%2Ftopic%2FG202132360%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860%23how_to&H=4OFMKT2X9TTIRHXLTB49PWAW01SA&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860>
    of your paperback at printing cost.
  * *KDP Community*. Here you can ask questions, learn from other
    experienced indie authors as well as stay up to date with KDP
    announcements, new features and share feedback. Visit the community
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=1ITILDSQ6Y7UU&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kdpcommunity.com%2F&H=MID5ZNHKLM8TA3IGKEMW1PPBI3SA>.
  * *Author Page*. Increase your sales potential on Amazon by creating
    an Author Central account, where you can share up-to-date
    information with readers on your Author Page. Create an Author Page
    on Amazon.com
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=1SYARP18WTLSE&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Ff.html%3FC%3D2EIU1YSKTC6SW%26K%3D17LV6H4OHICHM%26M%3Durn%3Artn%3Amsg%3A20190412171412079f2812843d416380b5433ede90p0na%26R%3D5DKF7L58GJY9%26T%3DC%26U%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fauthorcentral.amazon.com%252Fkdp%252F1533584303%253Fref_%253Dpe_3052080_397514860%26H%3DNCO6NVRBJLOSEC1EBHX3OKYPPTAA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860&H=WEOP37ATY70EUTQPRRBF0HOUDTKA&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860>,
    Amazon.co.uk

    Amazon.de
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=2GFEUYR4TME1G&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Ff.html%3FC%3D2EIU1YSKTC6SW%26K%3D17LV6H4OHICHM%26M%3Durn%3Artn%3Amsg%3A20190412171412079f2812843d416380b5433ede90p0na%26R%3D28G652NQV4U3I%26T%3DC%26U%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fauthorcentral.amazon.de%252Fkdp%252F1533584303%253Fref_%253Dpe_3052080_397514860%26H%3DYFGEOTIEDFMUIALVQ24M8H0IAVOA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860&H=6UWVKX3PJ2QTYGWIG1CUBVKND5QA&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860>,
    and Amazon.fr
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=2EIU1YSKTC6SW&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:2020052109001735d00c1288e04c3485db637c5100p0na&R=2PE3MY0A0KPP&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Ff.html%3FC%3D2EIU1YSKTC6SW%26K%3D17LV6H4OHICHM%26M%3Durn%3Artn%3Amsg%3A20190412171412079f2812843d416380b5433ede90p0na%26R%3D3UYSMA8ZLNQZI%26T%3DC%26U%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fauthorcentral.amazon.fr%252Fkdp%252F1533584303%253Fref_%253Dpe_3052080_397514860%26H%3DKYBXNQETIMONDXHYV4IWWASRZXOA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860&H=1NTEQTUAR4BSZMBABSQRBUAYVA4A&ref_=pe_3052080_397514860_pe_3052080_397514860>.

messages.content:
Summarize the email below into 2–5 bullets (who/what/when/next steps). Avoid speculation; use the email’s wording.

date: Tue, 12 May 2020 08:29:11 -0700
from: todd<todd@toddwriter.com>
to: Geoff Hilton<red.van@btinternet.com>
subject: Masks? Really?

Body:
Hi Geoff,

Welcome to the weird world of 2020!

Who would have predicted last year that the new fashion rage would be masks?

Of course, masks are really good at protecting others from your germs, 
not so much for protecting you from their germs (but a bit).

We're all right here in Vegas.  The life of a writer pretty much means 
that I'm mostly working from home anyway, although I do miss dropping 
into Starbucks and typing away there.

I hope you, Irma, and all the kids are okay.  I got worried when I 
realized that you'd planned for practically a world tour to visit the 
various far flung offspring.

I spent my 64th birthday at home and spent a lot of maudlin time 
thinking of the Beatles' "When I'm 64."  But the mood wore off soon 
enough and now I'm not feeling all that much different from 60.

I *have*, however, been planning on dropping you a line for months.  
Every night, as I'm drifting off, I'd say to myself "must write Geoff" 
-- well, finally I've done it!

Anyway, cheers, hang in there and I hope all is well with you and yours!

Cheers,

Todd

Hi Todd

Unfortunately Suzanne is the only person in education at the moment. For 
the time being, I recommend activating a Trial license so that you can 
get some work done while we wait for Suzanne to return tomorrow. A Trial 
has no limitations to it other than the 14 day time limit, so you'll be 
able to use it for anything you need during that time.
Your friendly neighborhood MAXON Tech Support guy, Steve.

Subject: 	Your book is available in the Kindle Store!
Date: 	Sat, 2 May 2020 07:54:23 +0000
From: 	Kindle Direct Publishing <kdp-no-reply@amazon.com>
To: 	us@oddballauthors.com

Hello,

Congratulations, your book “71 Seconds To Funding” is now live and 
available* for purchase in the Kindle Store! If you republished your 
book, your changes will be live in 24 hours.

Here are additional resources to help you promote your book and reach 
more readers:

  * Learn about the merchandising programs
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=3JZ5N0G6MFWFX&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%3FtopicId%3DA1LJROS8S7X0I5%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l1&H=JIAGCYIZLYY8W45CKX2YS04MSVWA&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l1>
    we offer, including ten ways to market your book
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=2QLHC3QDWM26S&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%3FtopicId%3DA37SMD4NYVZDI7%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l2&H=XB8VMWDMBHKSJY7AXAAY7TMHWPUA&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l2>.
  * Enroll your book in KDP Select
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=L2R0DR64VX37&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fselect%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l3&H=ZTEKE5JEEWAXV2OAW7APHPYVQL4A&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l3>,
    an optional program for you to reach more readers and earn more
    money. When you enroll your title in KDP Select, it will be included
    in Kindle Unlimited
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=1OLX12UVD77JY&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%3FtopicId%3DAA9BSAGNO1YJH%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l4&H=FIBSA7DKSNG5KZNBB1WS9PWO7ICA&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l4>
    for customers in the U.S., U.K., Germany, Spain, Italy, France,
    Brazil, Canada, Mexico, and India and the Kindle Owners' Lending
    Library
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=Z6BJ4Q24L44Z&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%3FtopicId%3DA3BQJE2QV37M1B%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l5&H=UWOUOOTUWUADTWWYEGJRZ3YKGC0A&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l5>
    (KOLL) for customers in the U.S., U.K., France, Germany, and Japan.
    You can also choose between two great promotional tools: Kindle
    Countdown Deals or a Free Book Promotion. To learn more, click here
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=22ZM1JJW407LE&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fkdp.amazon.com%2Fhelp%3FtopicId%3DA6KILDRNSCOBA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l6&H=PE8ZDGIWHDBDX0AFMD89OYAVG4AA&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_kdpgp_e_us_ble_nek_l6>.
  * Create an Author Page through Author Central
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/f.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=P9ROAQW3VXW&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fauthorcentral.amazon.com%2F%3Fref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_34&H=7SWZ5EBHE44YYTC6AYZGQ6WRHZAA&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_34>
    so readers can get information about you and your work. You can sign
    in to Author Central on Amazon.com
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/r.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=158GV0J7U2V5X&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fr.html%3FC%3D2VIM9W2T6LWPK%26R%3D177EQW6YGUCR3%26T%3DTC%26U%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fauthorcentral.amazon.com%252F%253Fref_%253Dpe_390220_155036590_34%26A%3DRACHKJFYKDU8LBY9FMEMBFSX1VYA%26H%3D6URLFLKY2ERUIAYDMYZ9CCYLODSA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_34&H=LPIKRAESAILANBITIQ8FCAT08U0A&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_34>
    or on Amazon.co.uk
    <https://www.amazon.com/gp/r.html?C=3Q4CM951BFX9C&K=2P4UR7V96S3F7&M=urn:rtn:msg:20200502075422300f8ee9566f4ddbba51c38f28a0p0na&R=2V0LMPPV20VEK&T=C&U=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fr.html%3FC%3D2VIM9W2T6LWPK%26R%3D177EQW6YGUCR3%26T%3DTC%26U%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fauthorcentral.amazon.co.uk%252F%253Fref_%253Dpe_390220_155036590_35%26A%3DEMX7KVVH5OMUMNHDALJELJG4BXOA%26H%3DLRKPEON24IQLPEO5VNXJOXECOTIA%26ref_%3Dpe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_35&H=DQU0D0V19RP2U59RVLPDY6RIHR4A&ref_=pe_3052080_277058210_pe_390220_155036590_35>.

The Kindle Direct Publishing Team
